KoNPiExCETLIpAAnoWaRWw.text: Los Cucos is one of the only Mexican sit down restaurants in this neighborhood.  It serves its purpose. Free chips and salsa. Nice service.  Happy hour margaritas.  Just don't expect the food to be super exciting.  It's good. Just not packed with a lot of flavor.

aXUv2HexZdEBAMpR8GDE6A.text: The establishment is clean, staff is friendly and very welcoming, however when it comes to the food it is bland and underwhelming. I might think about giving it another try but maybe I'll be giving it a bit longer to see if maybe the food gets better with time. My husband only took 2 bites of his burrito and was finished because he couldn't eat any more. We were still charged for it although it was barely touched. They never came to ask how things were or if they could get us anything else after dropping the food the next thing dropped was the check. They have the bones to make this a great spot but there certainly needs to be some work done to make the food better.

BsmrhsOr5cpdxkl0P8TxRA.text: Finally checking the place out.    We will be back.   Great food and prices ....nice crowd for a Tuesday evening can imagine how busy weekends must be.

08M1VJs_SsBESSRGhMkl5A.text: First  time here !!! My new fav! So glad it's so close to our house ! Friday's they have a live mariachi band ! Service and food was beyond amazing ! Michelle was our server and she went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed a night out and enjoyed our dinner ! Clean and everyone is super friendly ! Fajitas are just incredible! Can't wait to go back

125EBgjMWevalzlEdliMOQ.text: Awesome menu! Great atmosphere! The chips and salsa is delicious. Mexican Bowl rocks! Dolly is an amazing bartender!

kBS_l522_bpB7HTdBMEdvQ.text: Loved the customer service and mixed drinks.. the food portions are huge .. loved it .. will be a repeated customer

bxtKi8C7TcFNQWp9Pe4KaA.text: Love this place, best fish tacos! Good drinks and not too pricey- what more can you want? Service was good and the place is cute. Definitely will be back.

39z2qJyRD867zZCVa3W7Rw.text: This is my second visit, after a very disappointing first visit. I didnt tgink it was possible, but the food got worse abd tge service was poor. (We had to ask the bartender to get our waitress.)  My wife ordered the romaine salad with salmon. I ordered El Suegro, a combo of  tortilla soup, shrimp stewed with onion abd peppers in a tomato sauce and a fajita beef taco covered in a chili cheese sauce. My wife's salmon was crispy it was so overcooked; the waitress said it wasn't hard, just dry and she had told the "chef."   My soup was so salty, I couldn't  eat the broth, but did eat the vegetables. The stewed shrimp was disgusting. The shrimp tasted fishy and old in a canned tomato sauce wutg stewed onion and peppers. The fajita beef taco was as bad as tge shrimp: some dark colored, shredded meat (?) rolled in a flour tortilla  and smothered in a canned nacho sauce with sprinkles if salsa. I left almost the entire meal,  except what I tasted. No adjustment to the bill.  We won't  be back, even if it manages to stay in business

gfUeSK826AM12QjTOQtpQA.text: Four of us went for dinner. We all had something different and really enjoyed the variety. Service and atmosphere were very nice. Loved the fried stuffed avocado. Anxious to go again and try something different.

qEEnNGJtFOsaw6c-L4o3IQ.text: The service at Los Cucos is amazing and the food is even better. I've come here at least 10 times now and have never been disappointed. While everything on the menu seems to be a good choice, make sure you order the table side guacamole.

eDDAXAR6czhmTm5K-D-scw.text: My wife and I decided to try this place on a whim and, Thank Goodness we did. We ordered the Mixed Fajitas and they were Amazing, I feel like that still doesn't do it justice. If you are a Fajita lover then definitely go try this place. Homemade tortillas are the best in Vegas. Prices are great, nice atmosphere, and we never ran out of iced tea or water.

Ex3mePkcRUsrATBAgkfOqQ.text: Food is just OK - not the best for a sit down Mexican restaurant and honestly pretty overpriced given the quality and area (it's not like it's near the Strip). I didn't see a carne asada plate on the menu so asked the waitress who suggested I get a beef fajita plate. Instead of carne asada, it was seasoned ground beef (like hamburger meat) cut into strips. Tortillas were homemade and good, rice and chips, etc. good but it was $18 for that meal. Also tried cheese enchiladas another time which were just OK. Flaming Fajita is a lot better.

ZzXe5BwIV-HDEzb8rtCFMg.text: Good food, friendly bar staff too. The salsa was amazing and the enchiladas I had were very good. Will recommend.

F34rEFNqvQ54HYO3QcWrvQ.text: So I am updating my review for this restaurant. My first experience was not the greatest and I absolutely did not plan on coming back. But the owner and managers had asked me to come in and give them a second chance. I can honestly say now that we will definitely be recommending this restaurant to our friends as well as returning very soon. Our server, Gregorio, was excellent and the manager, Jesus, both went above and completely beyond our expectations to give us a much better experience. But not only was the service fantastic, the drinks and the food really were of the greatest quality! Everything is made completely fresh. From the guacamole to the queso with beef dip, to the homemade corn and flour tortillas for our fajitas. We had the fajitas with the chicken and steak topped with Serrano peppers, bacon and Monterey Jack cheeses. I highly recommend them for your entree here! I normally do not like beef fajitas from restaurants because the steak usually ends up being chewy, but definitely NOT these! The beef was so tender and flavorful!  If you're trying to decide on a beverage, the sangria swirl was soooooo good as well and very strong! We will definitely be back soon and if you're deciding whether to check this place out, you should and ask for Gregorio!

rP9Ip9HKX6i67q7xdFs6tQ.text: Salty salty salty everything was salty especially the red enchilada sauce couldn't finish my food I waisted 50 bucks won't be back alls I can say is that the bartender was super nice

DDy8UjQ48Px-CSalXkGAsQ.text: The fajitas are amazing, marinaded and tenderized and made from real skirt steak, unlike other restaurants in Vegas .    Since they are new, be patient in the early days, service was a little slow but food is terrific.  This is the best Mexican restaurant in the Southwest so give it a try.  Prices are reasonable and the kids menu is a plus for families.  Thanks for the great addition to our restaurant list!

swpFBOuEf8tbYcAYbw1Muw.text: Amazing, Amazing! From the chips and salsa to the margaritas to the main coarse. Couldn't have been any tastier. Luckily I came in during happy hour, I paid half price for the best margaritas.  Hopefully they don't lose their touch because I will be back very soon!!

FTfrhgZZ6DMCK_MDv1Dlzg.text: Wanted to try a new lunch spot close to home. The food here was amazing. I got the stuffed avocado and beef burrito. The beef(steak) was amazing! The flavors were full and on point. I want to go back and just eat a bowl of that meat. They also had warm salsa which was new for me and surprisingly good. The chips were also warm. Overall I went in with no expectations and walked out blown away. The prices are a little high even on the lunch menu however the portions and quality make up for it.

5fnN4ASGY8-s7GZDgnPCfA.text: Moving here from Texas six years ago, one of the things I truly have missed is Tex-Mex food.  The Mexican food out here has been disappointing.  When I saw they were opening this place, I wondered if it was the same Los Cucos as the ones in Houston.  When I walked in and asked them, I was elated to find out that it was the same!   And that they have the same menu.  They have an On The Border here, which is a Tex-Mex place, however, the menu is very different than the ones in Texas.  The Los Cucos menu was not.  It was the same!!!   I was very, very pleased to see that the cheese enchiladas were served with chili con carne or chili gravy instead of the disgusting red or green chile that most of these west coast places put on their enchiladas.  And they were good.  And the refried beans were perfect.  Some places make them too runny.  These were very good.  The service was excellent.  I had multiple managers come to the table and speak with me, and that was great.  My two complaints were that I was not a fan of the rice.  Although, I remember I didn't care for it when I went to the locations in Texas either.  For some reason, there was corn and carrots in it.  Just give me plain Spanish Rice.  Also, I used to like the red sauce they served with the chips in Texas.  However, I was not a fan of either of the sauces they served with the chips, and they were a little stale.  Also, the menu said they have Shiner Bock beer, and they do not.  At least not yet.  I hope they will eventually.  Overall, I was very happy with the meal and the service and very happy to have a place like this in Las Vegas finally!

IwoniiKVrE9nUWuNNFQkRQ.text: Excellent food & fantastic service. Our waitress Lupita was attentive and very friendly. We will definitely be going back !!!!!!

EQzhzqSPHBYu2meUXN88xw.text: Chips and salsa left much to desire, but honestly, the food, presentation and service more than made up for it! Highly recommend!!!!

MjzvqZJG7cNwR98LtrENGQ.text: Really delicious food and drinks. Management actually helps their staff. We were greeted immediately at the door, service was on point, and we loved our experience. Allen, the manager stopped at our table voluntarily and asked how everything was. We will for sure be back!

xLeh-_d7iLlE1cm9B_N4YA.text: I love the food and margaritas here. The tacos plazeros is excellent. Very friendly staff and love dealing with Alan (the manager). He is great as is his staff. One of my favorite places to eat!

OGDefeS4WSntbiNWuxObKg.text: EXCEPTIONAL!!!!!!!! EXCEPTIONAL EVERYTHING! Please listen to me when I tell you from the cleanliness, to the customer service (from the moment you walk in to the sever and the ENTIRE time you are dining), from the FOOD (oh my goodness the food) , just EXCEPTIONAL. I am Mexican so this is one of the best Mexican restaurants I have ever been too! You will not be disappointed! Elizabeth is an amazing server as well. TOP NOTCH service from her & literally all the other workers here!

My husband had chicken and steak fajitas and said both chicken and steak was very flavorful. I had the chicken chimichanga and it also was good. The rice had a good flavor also. Definitely recommend

fedYx-9dm2Pb1aMmpeAIiQ.text: Great friendly wait staff & manager.  Accommodating kitchen & tasty food. My friend had the chicken stuffed avocado & loved it. My veggie enchiladas could have used more salsa verde but very good otherwise. Menus & table could have been a little cleaner but we came at busy time. Overall,  good experience

-k5TrKA9UTz3zjlX10DtXw.text: Really disappointing. I ate here a long time ago when they first opened and it was delicious. We went last night and it was awful. The food was very greasy and I paid $21 for a steak that was mostly fat and hardly any meat. The steak knife was a POS, I had to use a butter knife! The rice was good but everything else was awful. Will not be going back!

eGCjRNBv126yUMIt9HA8hg.text: I have been here several times & had a great experience. Unfortunately, today wasn't a great experience. To start off with my margarita was not as good as it usually is. But what was worse is it took about 45 minutes to get my lunch order. I ordered my usual Just Fajitas but the meat was over cooked, the rice was hard & the hands made flour tortillas were hard as a rock. Would I give it another try? Probably. Everyone has a bad day.

0MOb6m1dNPAn0hZr-3-0qw.text: Absolutely delicious food! I had the stuffed avocado and had to take half gone it was so big! Our server Lupita was so sweet and attentive, definitely will be back!

l11mHKCQQrC04Uvdue72jQ.text: I'm usually never craving Mexican food unless it's tacos, but I tried this place out and I am so pleased. To start, I eat out alot (obviously) and I had the best customer service from all staff members ... Literally the best customer service I've ever had at a restaurant. Our server was Jose. he was super energetic and enthusiastic. The manager (I think) stopped by our table also to ask how everything was. Chips and salsa came out fresh and warm. Wasn't a fan of the red salsa only because there was no heat, and I'm a fan of anything spicy. The green salsa was cool and refreshing. My boufriend and I both got chimichangas and OMG they were the best I've ever had. We got chicken and beef and both were amazing. The chicken was perfectly cooked, packed full of flavor and so juicy !! The same with the beef. I preferred the beef one more and made my boyfriend switch me. It was so delicious I could not stop saying "omg this is so good".. the portions were also really big. I'm not a fan of rice and beans so my server substituted those for tortilla soup, free of charge! Soup was full of flavor but didn't have any meat in it. I wasn't bothered by it because I was more focused on my chimichangas. For dessert we got the trio. I would only recommend this for parties of 4+ as the portion was way bigger than the picture. Two giant scoops of ice cream covered in toasted coconut . Brownies and mini churros. The churros were piping hot and super fresh. Truly the best churros I've had in Vegas! We had such a hard time finishing this dessert. The plating was also really nice and clean. Overall I'm really happy with this place on all levels. Very clean, awesome service , and super flavorful food with big portions. I will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert trio. A little blurry. Can&#39;t tell from the photo but the portion is huge!
Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken chimichanga

lPGM2yDHAoG4Ft4yY2F12Q.text: The food here is always on point. The service is lacking. This is my 4th visit here. Though the staff is nice. The past two times being here, our server was just awful.  He started to take our drink orders. Kinda. He took two peoples orders and then left to attend to another table. Then when I brought it up, he was annoyed. He then took all of our drink orders, except left out one person again.  It was my brother in laws birthday. Granted we were there on Cinco de Mayo, the table next to us also had a birthday. We had asked for the balloon lady and band to come sing for him. Come to find out they didn't know what table they were there for. So it was awkward.  The food is always on point. No going wrong there. Just the service is lacking. If you can sit in the bar. Top service there... avoid Miguel. He just needs more training.

FdO_KeL7Fm-n-0Q6E-34Sw.text: 2nd time in and 2nd time happy!  Very clean, quick service from a friendly staff.  I cannot describe how happy I am to finally have a Mexican restaurant (besides taco shops) on this side of town! Our server this time was Lupita. She was super friendly and took amazing care of us on a busy Friday night.  I ordered their Los Cucos fajitas again. It's loaded with well flavored meat, sauteed mushrooms & onions and other veggies. Topped with jalapenos for some added spice and served with their homemade tortillas  Chips, salsa and the guac salsa are great too. We also really like the chili con queso as an appetizer.  They offer table side guacamole.  Margaritas are on point and served in a generous glass...no skimping on the liquor either. My favorite is their Cadillac margarita on the rocks.  Be sure to save room for dessert!  It is a Tex-Mex style Mexican restaurant.   Live mariachi music on a Friday night. The band walks from room to room serenading you as you enjoy your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sopapillas

1rXNx0stKHIo4EM_znfidw.text: We LOVE coming here! Honestly the only Mexican restaurant we go to as my fiance is Mexican and nothing touches his parents food EXCEPT this place is the closet we get to authentic Mexican food here in Vegas. My fiancee always gets the chimichanga and loves it. I decided to splurge this last time and get the lobster stuffed shrimp. SOOOO worth it. I always get a new drink off their very creative drink menu, haven't disliked one of them. Are waiter was AMAZING we unfortunately didn't get his name but his service was so attentive and literally refilled our drinks before they hit the table empty. We always leave full and happy which is honestly the best way to leave any restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XEx7Q1AN768hcQdqS0ptfQ.text: EXTREMELY disappointed in our last to go order. I have dined here several times and have had the fajitas a la pablanas with shrimp. A picture of their menu is on Yelp and this dish is there. It is CLEAR that you order a fajita style and pick your protein. My mother and I ordered a to go order of these fajitas to serve two. When I got to the restaurant I read my receipt and they had given us the pollo pablanos dinner but substituted shrimp. I started this was wrong, explained our order, and was asked to sit while they remade the dish. Of course, I was fine with this. 10 minutes later the manager came out and asked how I was doing. I said I was fine and was waiting on a remade to go order. He asked about what happened. I told him. He said he would go into the kitchen make sure it was right, but to be sure, show him what we wanted. I pointed to the menu. Pointed at the picture. He said they were again going to make the wrong thing and rushed to the back. He came back out, and I asked him with the menu in my hand and pointing, to confirm it was the correct dish. He assured me it was and said he would just charge us for the wrong dishes since they were cheaper to compensate for my trouble. He then proceeded to tell me he yelled at the order taker and made her cry and that they had 400 occupents so they were busy (a. I'd never ever want a server to cry for a simple mistake and b. I'm not sure the restaurant can hold 400, but I digress.) I get home and the dish is still wrong. It was horrible. No sauce. Rubbery shrimp with the tails on. No poblano peppers and DEFINITELY not fajitas. We called 5 times that night (because they weren't answering the phone and we had to keep trying) and they claimed they didn't make this dish. You know, the one I pointed to the picture of. They finally agreed to credit my card and said it would take 5 business days. Flash to 10 business days later and me calling because I still have not be reimbursed. The manager continues to claim they don't make this dish and never have, even though it's on the menu and I've ordered it multiple times. I just want my money back. The manager is put out by this and says he has to research the transaction and to call back in an hour. Alas, they never answered the phone that afternoon. I'm out my money. I REGRET ever telling people to go there. It's a shame. We were frequent customers but this has turned us off of the place completely.

2t49AGJKWk4qeaABHlM-Yg.text: I went to this place  a little while ago and nothing was impressive. Not the food, not the prices, not the service. I haven't and won't return. The carne asada seemed like it had been marinated for 5 mins. My wife's food was pretty bland as well. Wish they would move from this traditional meat rice beans dinner meals to more fun tacos and less filler foods like rice and beans. The beer was cold, however somehow they were out of my first and second choices on beer.. which was weird as they are domestic..

vjMvRUNocSvhT-KT2gnLhw.text: Always exceptional service.  The food is always hot and perfect as ordered.  Always work the drive for us. It is so nice for us.  The manager knows who we're are when we come in, and always welcome us back.  Thank you again for a lovely evening. Looking forward to the next time.  Happy holidays!

rDRJxvin455pRebJDOeceA.text: My new favorite Mexican restaurant. Food was great drinks were great, but the service was beyond exceptional.

LYZfs2Hy--M565tBuCDxDg.text: Denis was the most amazing server! We had a table for 17 and got every... order... right! Service was fast and friendly and we didn't even have reservations on a Friday night. Fajitas were terrific.

zyRor_Ufgpwr1462-6mFAw.text: This place was pretty amazing!  Went here for lunch fora Work luncheon. Everyone left full and completely satisfied!

IL4c-TxNjzAT9r8jOZ1LEQ.text: The food was delicious!  Loved the table side prepared guacamole!  So fresh! They also make their salsas and tortillas/chips on site! Hubby got a platter that had a grilled steak with enchiladas.  I got a grilled tilapia platter wth a jicama/radish slaw on top with a side of black bean soup and charred corn with poblano peppers on the side.  It also came with white rice but that was completely unnecessary. Huge portions.    I only have two complaints 1.) the steak had a thick gristle streak in it.  Hubby ate around it but was tender otherwise and seasoned nicely.  2.) also, the black bean soup was mostly beans but were perfectly cooked.  There was hardly any broth which was a shame for me because it was absolutely delicious. Next time I will ask for less beans and more broth.  I'm still giving this restaurant a five though because what I loved the most about Los Cucos was the amazing service!  It was busy but you wouldn't know it.  Victor our server was very friendly and attentive.  Our glasses were never empty and he was very knowledgeable about the menu and came over several times to check on us.  We will definitely be back!

a0n2krIOy682DI6FligCdA.text: I recently moved to Las Vegas and found this little gem. The food was delicious, love the ambiance, and the service was perfect - shout out to Priscilla!

jcfXQ5BXdKjMyJV6EP_EKA.text: Been here twice now with different friends each time and everyone agrees it's great! There are the "standard" items like burritos, fajitas, and tacos, but so much more including delicious ceviche. They also know how to make a quality cocktail, not just "margarita in a blender" like many places. Desserts are quite good also. Prices are normal for a nice but not fancy restaurant - figure $25-35/person depending on menu selection incl a cocktail.

Rswh0eiDKGPEo1Vpfv2e1w.text: If you're looking for a great environment to take your family and friends to for a great food experience this is highly recommended. Jesus and Jaime catered for one of our parties and was very professional and helpful. Everyone was asking about them. So we're using them again for our next party.  When it comes to great service, great food, and good people-this is our go to spot!

B8ruqHNe7WrXHvP_EelmgQ.text: I have been to Los Cucos several times and it is now my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. There food is not your average Mexican food. There food can be spicy so if that bothers you ask to leave out the jalapenos. There brunch was excellent too. The service is usually fast and always very friendly. I highly recommend this place.

RXu-8PgRbhS5TlfVgkYrHA.text: I love Mexican food and live really close to this location and couldn't wait to try it! My boyfriend, friend Cindy, and I went in yesterday around 3pm to give it a try! The place was pretty empty but that's cool with me! We sat at the bar and the bartender we was very nice but the only reason I am not giving a 5 star review is because I asked him for a drink menu and he didn't give it to me and acted like here was not one..... I ordered a margarita he recommended and it was good but had I seen the rather extensive drink menu I would have tried something else for sure! How ever the food was good... we all like the beef the best! I thought it was very well flavored but the brisket and carnitas where disappointing... I will be back to try those interesting cocktails for sure!

6MImk0vn4CbCwUzwtLymVA.text: Today was my first visit to Los Cucos.  I had high expectations and was excited to try it.  When we arrived the hostess, was nice and seated us promptly.  The ambiance was strange, I felt like it was trying to be an authentic Mexican restaurant, but couldn't quite get there. It was "cold" and lacked that home-like feeling one typically would encounter.  The wait staff was nice, though our service felt rushed.    I ordered the La Bonita Plate (3 pcs) chicken fajita quesadillas, (1 pc) beef fajita taco covered with chile con queso and (1 pc) chile con queso puff tostada.  Honestly, it was lacking and for $16.99 I expected more.  The Chicken Quesadllas were mostly cheese, The beef  fajita taco, was not a taco at all.  It was a rolled torilla with meat in it; That's it meat and tortilla, with some cheese wizz queso (I should have taken a picture).    What surprised me was the chile con queso puff tostada.  This wasnt even a tostada; It was simply a torilla that was blown up like a balloon (hallow and empty inside).  There was nothing inside and some of the wizz on top.  Taco Bell has out performed this meal.    I will tell you that two of my co-workers ordered the Super Salad and raved about them.  From the looks of it - they were well portioned.  Neither of them could finish their dish.  What really prompted me to write this?  Well besides the mediocre food, it was our first time here.  I certainly did not expect anything from telling our waiter this, but I would have thought that he would have had some good recommendations.  His suggestions seemed random and disingenuous.  I may or may not be back, the jury is still out...

953ut3WsVyucRNWRtBvvVw.text: Let me just say that their breakfast buffet is beyond delicious! There was an abundance of food that I couldn't decide what I wanted to eat. They had everything that I my family would make for breakfast and lunch. They had eggs, waffles, sausage, bacon, tacos, tacos dorados, Chile's rellenos, enchiladas, ceviche, fruit, hot chocolate, pan dulce, flan, arroz con leche, cereal, milk, juice, horchata, Jamaica, and agua de pepino... there was wayyy more food than I can remember! My family will be back!

U6hyfd9-ZduQLufgDfnH1g.text: Good Tex-Mex, I had the enchiladas and was very happy with them. Margaritas were delicious and happy hour had them cheap, after one I had a buzz so be careful . My bartender was Sergio and he was awesome, super friendly and very attentive.

jyy9JFa8lyNuhZ2Zc8W7sw.text: We showed up at 9:30 pm right before closing (I'm sorry, bad I know). So I wasn't expecting this place to blow me away, but the servers were all super nice and the food was amazing!  I got the steak and rice bowl, and the steak was sooo good. (give me your marinade please!) haha. I love the salsas they gave me with my bowl, you could tell everything is made to order!  My husband got a chicken chimichanga and he loved it!   We will def be back early on a friday night!

Ww_bKYO1tbCTLjDHgyycQg.text: Best Mexican restaurant  in town. We love this place, the service is phenomenal and the food is so amazing. This is our go to date location. Every time we leave full and happy. The staff never let your cup go empty and the food has always come out within an appropriate amount of time and is well cooked and flavorful. I can't rave about this place enough, we love it.

NOcPZlkFQb3qK-h64EuXaA.text: Service & Food Meets Expectations, a Favorite! Highly recommend the Queso Fundido, Ceviche and the Dessert Trio & Flan. The Food & Service makes you want to go back again and again. Authentic Food and Hospitality. If you like Spanish food, Los Cucos will have you loving it. Price & Portions are Perfect!

XVgnQE8mPJfC6QahZYlEBQ.text: This was our first visit here and I have to say I am beyond impressed. The service was awesome, Denis and manager Manuel rock, and the food... wow! Amazing! Everything we had was 5 stars. The stuff jalapeno, the stuffed avocado, the pollo del Mar, and of course the margaritas. AMAZING! Our new place, bye Lindo Michigan!

6uGzXim_Ukv_b1kABnzvvw.text: This is my second time here, and this place does not disappoint. I got the deep fried chicken avocado which was great. Their queso is great and very great customer service. This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants around this area.

The chef sent out an extra queso fundido topping for the fajitas that was incredible! The staff are a delight. Our server was Elizabeth, and she was so much fun to talk to. Service was superb. W28ilNab1Ug4RePk71Fs1A.text: This place is so amazing ! Awesome lunch time service ! Great lunch special pricing and timely delivery !!! Margaritas are bomb !

bqyDgR-iaSZ-mxqIgoV-hQ.text: There are so many other better places to go for Mexican food, the environment was good but the food wasn't worth the price. Everything is over priced and not good. I ate there a few hours ago and it made me sick.

qCWDB_aKHgE0mCECUZJjIg.text: Seriously, this place is the genuine article!   My wife and I are always looking for genuine Mexican food, like the kind you find in Mexico. It can really vary, depending on the region that inspired the menu, and family recipes.   I can say this, there is True heart and soul in the food here. I had their bacon wrapped shrimp, which was perfectly seasoned, and oh so very tasty. We also had the shrimp stuffed avocado. Wow. It was a first for us, but it was as good as it sounds!   Normally, we are super picky, and impossible to please. The rice might not be great, or the beans might be bland. Here, everything was just exceptional. Great beans, tasty rice, and perfect tortillas.   We spent nearly a year in Mexico, and it still took several months to find the "right" tortillas. These might even be better!   We couldn't stop telling the staff how excellent everything was.   I normally don't take the time to post Yelp reviews, but this place absolutely earned my time.   My only regret is that we are not local. If you are local, appreciate your luck in having an awesome, authentic Mexican restaurant with such a delicious menu. Best meal I've had in quite some time.   Next time we come to Vegas, we WILL be back!

8IYE_P06XGb-L7CfqsT1hQ.text: Best fajita dishes in all of Vegas bar none! There's this plate called Delicioso. I mean it couldn't have been named more aptly right? I mean you take one bite of any one of the delicious meats or veggies on this plate: beef, chicken, shrimp (and by shrimp I mean the biggens), fish, pork, peppers, onions, tomatoes, and you're instantly in culinary heaven. Someone told me their food is made from scratch and I'm bound to believe this is True, the beans look like they were given love and care from your abuelita's kitchen prepped the day before. The service we got from Eloisa was fantastic. Margaritas served by Brenda behind the bar are expertly made and a few sips of it sneak up on you fast. I highly recommend drinking first cause once the food comes out it's all you'll be concentrating on. Definitely had leftovers to take home, their plates are big.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1EdIIgUcYd3W4z7rUfiVvA.text: The food here is so fresh and made with love. The service is also amazing....the atmosphere is very casual and yet inviting.

SzmwsXeE1qDuv3JPqF7eMw.text: Worst service ever!!! Sat there for an hour and a half before food ever came. Manager brought the food out and never said a word. One meal completely inedible as it sat under the heat lamp for ever. Rice and beans were crusted over. Took "half off" the bill... but wouldn't even take the meal that couldn't be eaten off the bill. Allen is the GM and never even apologized for the wait.   To the manager below that commented.... "time passing" will not help... maybe a sincere apology from the manager that ignored us and then went and hid in the back would help.

Hp0erBQFBsXwkjyxF7O52Q.text: Sadly my husband and I convinced our child to go here over Chili's. It seems like a white person from Wyoming's version of Mexican food.  No offense to white people or those from Wyoming. We're white and we wouldn't serve this food. Anyway. It's as far from authentic as you can get. Tortilla chips are flour, salsas without much flavor or spice, my "taco" was a flour tortilla with some sort of beef inside it...my husband had a nasty looking burrito and are son got the burger which was obviously from a frozen package. Its texture nasty. Service was fine. Food regrettable.

FdmOHA8gYkNyIJwhhp6NOA.text: Was my favorite spot, but it's died a death. Food is painfully slow and then it comes out warm!   My wife and I have tried to give it every chance, going back every week for the food and "Lupita" an excellent server and a sweetheart. Unfortunately we can't cross town just to talk to a nice person.  The menu is good but if they can't correct these two very important issues, they're done!

d7d0ilmcEBBdA-Hjthnq3A.text: We were wondering for a very long time what was Mimi's Cafe going to be changed to since it closed down. Here it is Los Cucos Mexican food. I think that the place is a great place for families to eat some decent Mexican food.   Best things about this place we enjoyed were  Chorizo queso dip   Fresh tortillas they were definitely home made so buttery and I would come back just to have this  Fajitas were good too. The only thing we didn't enjoy about this was the menu said it was filet mignon and it definitely wasn't filet mignon you can't fool me on that it was thick flank.   The portions are also huge so you can definitely share 1 plate for two or just don't order an extra appetizer like we did and enjoy the fresh chips n salsa that's free when you eat here. Service was awesome from start to finish. Overall I would come back more if the refried beans were a smoother texture but other than that it's a solid place the only reason I'm giving a 3 star versus a 4 was for the steak issue we had. But it's a solid 4

LisUwrY6NINd8HxkKD43fQ.text: Sooooo, I went back this week and met up with co-workers. Once again, friendly, great service. The food was also very good, but I'm here to say that they make wonderful margaritas!!! The menu we ordered drinks from last time looked more like a seasonal menu because I could not find the drinks we ordered last time. It was a different menu. So I went with what the staff told me last time " try the margaritas, they are really good", and the margaritas did not disappoint. I had the margarita anejo and holy cow, that thing was so good. I don't know why we ordered all those weird drinks last time cause the margaritas is where it's at!!!  So good and I have been craving one all week. If I'm wrong, I must admit it, I WAS WRONG about the drinks.

jEVhF5wOhKEQzQ3EW-6lig.text: I bring friends for lunch here often. Their soup is delicious and anything I've tried I liked. If I had a suggestion, it would be the lighting. I'd have a group meet at the bar, but it's so bright in the whole restaurant, makes for not an inviting dinner date spot or happy hour bar. I hope they change this quickly so I can recommend the restaurants to more people for dinner.

QNNYvv9MqxhIm5HR_AWFxw.text: Outstanding food! Came here for lunch, mostly because we were starving and we weren't expecting much. It looks like a chain restaurant, so we were expecting to get mediocre food like Chi Chis or something. Instead, we ended up being blown away by some of the most delicious fajitas we've ever enjoyed. The steak was melt-in-your-mouth tender and the fajitas were covered in a fantastic house sauce that took it to the next level. Everything was hot, fresh and wonderful, would definitely come back!

JvQsdLBfO5SE-8T3cv-Gbg.text: Found this spot in the southwest from a friend who told me that I had to try the weekend buffet. He told me he came twice before coming with me. So once I get here, I found out that its like Mexican food heaven. They have a TON of food and for only $20. They had everything from chile rellenos, elote, enchiladas, chilaquiles, tacos, menudo, omelettes, tamales, empanadas, champurrado, chicken and mole, horchata etc and everything was delicious. I would say my favorite was probably the empanadas and the carnitas tacos (they have a little station where someone prepares it for you). They were both exploding with flavor. Maybe a little greasy but in my opinion it gives it so much flavor haha! There is so much good food that I didn't get to try all the desserts. I got full on all the delicious food they have available. And they have a ton of those too. Also they use plastic cups for the agua frescas so you can take them to go! Will definitely come back and finish trying all the desserts. And to stuff my face again lol. Loved it here!

POMU2HT8NznKhtfhQiCxKA.text: I am so happy that the southwest side of town finally has a good Mexican food restaurant. We have been here a couple times and it never disappoints. The tortillas are handmade and very delicious. There was one time that we went that didn't settle well with us on the experience, however we have been back and will continue to be going. The fajitas are absolutely amazing and a must try.

igbhLTYA2B48H3TZCxoxew.text: I've had my eye on this place since it was shut down... First wondering how long this was going to stay closed and then when it was going to open....Lol  Once I saw that it was open and I read that it was supposed to be Tex Mex...I dragged my bf there for lunch... I'm from Texas and it had been so long since I had good Tex Mex...I had to give this place a try.  The chips were good... Perfectly crispy and the red sauce and the green sauce were both good. The first batch of chips were served room temp but the second basket (Yes I was a little porker) was served warm which was a great surprise. The red sauce was served warm which I thought was a great touch! 5/5  My bf got the cheese enchiladas and he said they were decent but nothing to write home about.   I got the fried avocado with beef with the tortilla soup. I was sadly disappointed. The tortilla soup had mushrooms in it... Which I have never seen in any tortilla soup ever and the tortilla strips were totally soggy... So no texture. Flavor was ok but it was not like any tortilla soup that I have ever had. It was more like a vegetable soup with tortilla thrown in. :( The fried avocado was decent. The crust was fried to  golden crispiness and the avocado was decent. It did not taste that ripe to me. And I guess to finish this all off was that the beef was tough with lots of cartilage and fat. Flavor was actually good but I had to spit out quite a few bites. (1/5)  Service was actually quite good. I didn't catch my server's name but that guy never stopped moving once. He went from table to table to table to table to table... He was like Energizer Bunny....Lol 5/5  Most likely I will try this place again... But I'm not chomping at the bit.

Food was ok, but menu didn't list all ingredients as I ordered tacos which came with onions I had to remove.   Nothing special about this place especially the disgusting rice and beans.  There was no 15% discount on yelp.

1CTJJqvHNAtSai8HLLVkSQ.text: A few things:  One: when you gamble at bar they comp not one drink, its Vegas get with the program  Two: we ordered our food to go the young lady in the front is in the wrong position.  As a former greeter you need someone with a smile and be at least a little thankful to smile at your customers.  Then she didn't input the order properly.   Three: as we were waiting for our food a few people walked in and no one was there to help them.  The young lady left to the back and people were waiting for a while to be seated.   Four: when our food came out they didnt even review our order with us they just said here   I would not recommend this place to anyone there are other restaurants with way better service and same or better price.  Most that have gambling will comp some drinks which is a bonus.  And if ordered out, they will review the order with customers.    If you need recommendations let me know. I love Mexican food.

oOayHCT0xotqLcsn7tCsAQ.text: Johnny on the spot with hot fresh chips, salsa, guac upon sitting down. Food was decent and good volume, 3x more than I really should eat. Service is quick and on point! 3_76oJhoAE_qN0gnQYy45Q.text: Absolutely delicious. Stopped in to give them trial run finally. Located just minutes away from the office, this moment was inevitable. Service was friendly and the speed from ordering to the food reaching the table felt perfect. The waitress recommended the steak chimichanga as well as a few other items on the menu. that chimichanga looked pretty enticing so I decided to go with the recommendation, and I was very grateful that I did. The chimichanga came out perfect, with a wonderful texture to the fried tortilla it was encased in, to the overall temperature, and the flavor of all ingredients inside. The steak was tender and quite fulfilling to the taste buds, and the rice and beans paid an excellent contribution to the overall experience. It landed at $20, with the meal, soda and just shy of an 18% tip. Chips and salsa were provided along with a refreshing thin avocado salsa that was great. there is no doubt that I will come back to this place in the near future!

JCoyPou5KifIGTp2yNRREw.text: First time at this place and I was very impressed. I can be a bit too critical of places, but I can't think of one negative thing! Warm welcome, great waitress, amazing salsa and chips. This place was referred to me and my family, who were with me, would do the same. We all had a great time and meal here. The fajitas were on point...full of flavor, NOT dry (which happens a lot at other places) and had great sides. Not to mention the house made tortillas! I can't wait to come back.

Q-OHcofcNczkRb70s6tYdA.text: We come here almost every Friday! The San Marcos platter is amazing. Everything is very flavorful and we always receive great service. Check this place out!

hFoJN2FmMgu8vc6D-7T8Tg.text: Absolutely the worst service we have had in a long time.  The lady that was taking care of us completely ignored us and it took forever.  She was with a booth across from ours who must of been family or friends and proceeded to sit down with them and speak non stop to Spanish with them for over an hour.  When I tried to get her attention for another round of drinks I was given a dirty look and she went right back to talking to them.  We love the food here but she even got that wrong.  I have a food allergy and she did not let the kitchen know.  I went without eating because of her ignorance.  WE WILL NOT BE BACK!!!

Xe7RrV-vQ7xHn2Ms8O8OhA.text: Pretty good for Tex-Mex! Their prices range from low to higher end depending on whether you get a combo or a parrillada. The flavor is definitely there and the serving size is well worth the price. I recommend trying the Fried avocado with beef plate. It was interesting, filling, and very good. The Los Cucos Chicken stuffed with Shrimp which was also very tasty and it was a big portion. I forgot when the Happy hour is because they have odd times, but I'll find out next time we make it out!

The decor of the restaurant is beautiful. It has this lime green wall and beautiful plants. It's really light and airy.  We ordered a chicken dish and a combination plate.  Everything was absolutely delicious and service was wonderful.  This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant in the southwest.

xDgDD4dWoteCPRoe2jXUTQ.text: I love the foods here make fresh and beautiful deco. All girl here dress up beautiful. Very traditional Mexican restaurant mixed with American style. Delicious foods.

yBivYv7_SE7oZ-oLT27qUw.text: So this is my favorite Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas. I'm in love with their Stuffed Avocado! This review is complete opposite of my 1st visit a year and a half ago because I couldn't believe the manager went back and forth with me over "extra cheese!" I usually dine in when I come here and always order the same thing cooked the same way. Stuffed Avocado with Beef, Extra White and Yellow Cheese. Well my visit a couple days ago was for take out. I ordered the exact same thing as always. When I got my to go order I took a fork to open the avocado and there was a small amount of Yellow Cheese with Beef. I asked one of the waitresses to please give me a side of White Cheese. She went to the back and out came Wynne the Lady Manager who took my order and a Little Man Manager who started talking to Wynne in Spanish as he punched some buttons on the cash register. He pulled up and printed my receipt showing me that Wynne didn't charge me for EXTRA CHEESE! I told the little man that I eat here often, order the same thing and am NEVER charged for Extra Cheese! In fact other managers have given me free dessert because I praise their food so highly every time I come. He went back and forth with me then finally said OK I'll give it to you this time but next time I'll charge you. If this wasn't the ONLY Mexican Restaurant that made Stuffed Avocados I'd NEVER visit this establishment AGAIN!!! The little man left a bad taste in my mouth but it was soon replaced by the Delicious Stuffed Avocado I ate when I finally made it home clear on the other side of town! Yes I drive about 40 minutes to come here for good Mexican Food! Not so much for PETTY Extra Cheese talk!!!!

KH2TGHeUyoBop-1-hkOR8A.text: The food was soooo good! It was so fresh and it was fast and friendly service. I was on my lunch break and asked if the could speed up their normal, they were so accommodating. I had 2 taco platter; brisket and chicken. The tortillas were homemade and just delicious. I can't wait to try new menu items.

r8KUZqfQyE48ClsF19NoWw.text: Wow! The devil is in the details because their rice taste and corn tortillas taste home made as well as their tortilla chips!  I can't believe how great this place is I will take other people I love here too

3gGsX8OyQwb7baE0Ce7HmA.text: We came here today for brunch. It's a bit pricey at $19.99 (sorry my opinion) the food was scrumptious. I am not a big fan of Mexican food but I left more than full. I do not like much spicy food but still was able to eat a lot. The juices were a little watered down but still with flavor. The hot chocolate, coffee with cinnamon and champorado were very good. The dessert table was also scrumptious. The only reason I didn't give 5 star was - there were no labels on everything. We had to flag down a server and keep asking what the food were. Even the ceviche choices were the best. If there were labels maybe (saying also if spicy) then we can avoid waste. Overall the food and service were great!

4uq4FAXsstG4dhgjLC1RMg.text: My girlfriend and I decided to go here around 7:45 pm on a Wednesday night. We were sat down and we ordered our food around 7:50. After we ordered we had to wait until 8:40 to get our food. During this time the waitress did not come by and mention if the food was going to take long or not. When the food finally arrived it was extremely salty. We have been here before but this time the food was too salty and the service was terrible. I would definitely not recommend anyone to come here, especially after such a long wait for our food.   -Poor Service -Long Wait -Salty Food

Hs9rlZg0fU8SGbRpq-1f6A.text: Unique menu options and plated well. Definitely liked seeing the healthy selections. A good work week lunch option. I didn't see a kid's menu but this place is listed as kid-friendly. The server barely spoke English and maybe 3 words to me during the entire experience. No biggie, but at least welcome me, ask me if I have any questions on the menu (it was my first time) and let me know what the mystery green dip is with my chips (guessed it was a tomatillo salsa-sour cream-guac mix?!). EtRg2HtrPAHUPpikjbXB9g.text: My wife was excited to try this place since they open.  After reading mixed reviews we decided to try it out.   Ordered the ranchero burrito and when it came out the portion was huge. At first bite, I couldn't place the sauce until a few bites later that I realize the red sauce had small portion of ground beef in it. It tasted like meat spaghetti sauce was poured on top. Fushion?   Wife ordered stuffed avacado and the presentation was uniquely nice. Taste was bland. Got Salt?  Yelp 15% coupon check in expires on 9-30-17, but requires to be printed before coming.  Manager came by and asked how did everything taste.  I asked him about the sauce on my burrito and he said that's how it is in Texas. I like all kinds of food and I know Tex Mex and this was far from it.  I personally can't recommend and agree with Yelpers who feels this place completely missed the mark.  Our server Maria was super attentive, which is why they got two stars instead of one.

beZKTbwvKQnN5kLgnIWKHA.text: Los Cucos is amazing! Whenever we are in the area we always eat here. Great, now I am hungry!

pAYwrYpyoc3z7BlA-cWWsA.text: Went for dinner with 4 other adults. It was our first time here and since we are new to the area we don't have our favorite Mexican restaurant yet. We heard they have stuffed deep fried avocados so that intrigued us.  We came on Saturday, around 5ish and the restaurant was half empty so we got seated right away. Our server was very friendly and attentive. The menu is like no other, not your typical Mexican restaurant. We all ordered dishes that we have never had before and were very happy, and full!  I had chicken stuffed deep fried avocado that came with tortilla soup, rice and beans and a beef fajita soft taco (I think). I didn't try the beef fajita soft taco because I was full from the stuffed avocado. This restaurant will definitely be our go to for Mexican food.

2cCixR-t3Nlf4F-9p9ItCQ.text: Not a fan of any of the food here. Some of the worst fajitas, enchiladas and salsa I've had. The server was great and attentive but the food was terrible.

W-x-2WrRHZ4IqNKNXiJK4Q.text: This is great Mexican Food and the restaurant is clean and bright! Their Sunday brunch is great and they have a wide variety of choices.

ow2KE2a6C89RyYwdAtzLoA.text: Los Cucos, a family-owned Texas chain, has been open in this location for about 1.5 years.  This is our second visit.  We'd visit more often, but don't live close.  We had concluded our business at neighboring Men's Wearhouse, so decided to have an early lunch at Los Cucos.  We arrived at 10:43; the restaurant doesn't open until 11:00 AM.  The hostess was very nice and told me that we could come inside.  When I returned a minute or two later with my husband, the manager greeted us and told us he'd be glad to seat us in the restaurant.  He saw us to a table and chatted with us about the restaurant's history.  He brought us two very welcomed cervezas.  Before we knew it, we had chips, salsa and an avocado dip.  Lupita provided excellent service.  People checked on us throughout the meal, including the chef, the waitress and the manager.  We each had a chicken taco which was stuffed with chicken, as well as sauteed onions.  We split a spinach quesadilla.  That was too much food for seniors; we've gotta learn to start sharing meals.  We were never without water.  Our check came quickly.  We really appreciate the level of customer service which allowed us to be seated before the restaurant opened.  It's too darn hot to sit in a car in a parking lot in Las Vegas waiting for a restaurant to open.  We wouldn't have done that; we would have headed for our end of the valley and stopped elsewhere on our way home.  This GM knows how to develop customer loyalty.

qvgR5zTh7HwG4J7eHBQggg.text: Best food in town. Everything on the menu is delicious. Can't help over eating every time I go there. Beware!! You will crave this place the second you are hungry again. If you manage to make Sunday brunch you are in for a real treat.

IGZL1zmKapAj8SJbC5CCpQ.text: Alas, a more revived & cultivated taste of Mexican Cuisine for the Las Vegas area!  "Los Cucos" will provide a diverse menu of 100+ selections for all dining types whether it be for family, romantic, business, happy hour and even private events. Upon entering, the setting is gorgeous & spacious with a modern cultural ambience ala Mexicana. Be assured, that excellent service & smiles from the staff are contagious in delivering a rewarding dining experience. As a visitor during it's grand opening week, I was immediately greeted by the manager, Jesus, and guided with glowing recommendations. I selected the "Carnitas ala Michoacana" from their lunch menu. The presentation was impressively artistic & its flavors exploding in the diversity of fried juicy pork bathing in fresh tomatillo sauce while accented with queso fresco & crisp sliced onions. Add in fresh handmade corn tortillas with moist Mexican rice & refried beans. The value & generous portions are too hard to ever pass up. I look forward to providing a follow up review of their Seafood, children's menu & Desserts.  Located at Arroyo Crossing Parkway Plaza, "Los Cucos" is destined to become the community's social & dining benchmark.  "Bien Provecho Amigos!"

7H8-tuv5mze7zfycMhk4TA.text: This used to be a Mimis Cafe and u can still see the old mimis layout inside. The interior is nothing exciting at all but I'll come back to that. I've watched for months as they converted the place into a mexican restaurant and eagerly waited for them to open. The food is really good. The salsas they bring out with the chips are not traditional. The red salsa was heated in the oven and the greenish salsa was like an aioli mayo based concoction. I didn't mind either but my friend was not a fan.  Margaritas were cheap and very good. We ordered a large variety platter for 2 people to share and it was so good. We received steak and chicken fajitas, grilled shrimp, a green onion and bacon sauce, rice, beans and more.  The perfectly seasoned steak was so tender it just fell apart in my mouth. After that I didn't expect much from the chicken but it was also perfectly seasoned and so soft. I would definitely give the food 5 stars and the staff could not have been any more friendly and on top of things. The only dissapoitment is regarding the interior design. The walls are pretty bare and there aren't any cool mexican decorations.  It looks more like a cafe than a full restaurant.  If they could get an interior designer in here to make it look more like Panchos or Lindo they would be golden.

I wanted to order a drink- no way! Couldn't locate my waiter. Our order was  wrong - couldn't tell anyone. After we paid our bill, I was able to locate a manager who said "well everyone is having an off night so just come back another time." No thanks. EIBVIjvzcitb7wHp1uEPtg.text: This place is really cute inside and outside. It reminds me of a Macayos or something. The staff is fantastic. They are all really nice and quick with service. I would give them five stars for that alone.  The reason I gave them 3 stars is cause Mexican is my favorite food and I could normally clean my plate but I really didn't love anything that my friends or I got. And for the price I was expecting more.   I had the chimichanga. It wasn't bad but it wasn't something I'd try again. It had nacho cheese over it which I thought was unique but it ended up just tasting like fast food.  It just seemed white washed Mexican and lackluster.  It wasn't terrible but it just wasn't my thing.

J_9CeCVLhagBydDTW1hzAg.text: Los Cucos - - a great Mexican cafe We had a great meal here. The servers were very friendly, helpful and attentive to our needs. We started with original queso and queso chorizo which were both very good. For the main meal we had the mixed fajitas and chicken salad. The portions sizes were monstrous.. We took home food for two more meals. The place is easy to find just off the freeway but in the back of the outdoor mall like area. Well worth the drive from where ever you are in Las Vegas.

1Gw1XOP_OUsNthYBzftzXw.text: First time here and it wasn't bad. We enjoyed our drinks and enjoyed the food. The menu is quite big, so it took us awhile to pick what we wanted. But it was good. Beans were pretty salty(and I love salt) and my wife was given 2 tortillas with her meal and they were rock hard. I had the taco and soup and it was delicious! I picked the tortilla soup(YUM) and the steak taco was sooooo tender and yummy!  I could see us coming back sometime.!

x5Ew3g4Vu9v7JxuBfDU0Hg.text: In the middle of all the business at the rainbow and 215 area is this little gem. I've been there twice and let me give you what I enjoy the most. Very delicious and cute little spot.

_3VlKHT6aE1mK1kBZzwj6A.text: This restaurant is amazing!! I have been coming here since they opened at least once a week. The shrimp quesadillas are my favorites and the daiquiris. The best waitress is Elizabeth.  Great place to eat!

TdSAwnqiiCz4AN5EGvYwVw.text: If there was a negative 5 stars I would choose that ranking! This place started off amazing, service was great and polite. Margaritas were OKAY, could have been stronger but I left the last test up to how the food would taste.   When food came it was very hot and tasted amazing, UNTIL my mother pulled a long strand of hair out of her enchiladaWhat the hell!!! We called over the sever who I could tell was hesitant to approach without the manager, I could see them conversing behind my mom (which was also unprofessional). An older lady came from the kitchen and pointed at our table, I noticed she had on an hair net but it was half on covering her hair.   I signaled for the manager, she came over room the hair and the food and asked my mom if she wanted another one! HELL NO. After that it was no apologies and complete avoidance of the table. The didn't charge us for the meal but I would have liked more customer service and empathy! We were treated like we were the problem.   I have been wanting to eat here for a year and finally had the courage to try something new! FAIL I will stick to Lindo Michoacan in Henderson. They are the best thus far and have the best view on the city and drinks!   Too bad guys could of had a customer for life. I live down the street

OUe3nkZq4FjZzu80kGJVbg.text: My hubby and I have date night once a week. We try to go to different restaurants around town, but we do have our favorites that we frequent more than once. This place is one of them. Tonight was our 4th visit and we are still impressed. Each time we've come we have had amazing food, fresh ingredients, large portions, friendly service, attentive staff and fast delivery. The restaurant itself is always clean, fun decor, great music and a comfortable atmosphere.   Tonight we had a genuinely happy waitress named Elizabeth who was pleasant and cheerful, just a pleasure. We assumed the man that came after her to make sure we were enjoying our meal was the manager, which we always love seeing management interacting with customers. He recognized my dish, Pollo Del Mar (outstanding by the way, I highly recommend) and said it was one of their signature dishes. He seemed proud of the product and I could see why.   5 stars all around; service, atmosphere, food, price point and portion... great restaurant, one of our favorites

kZSk30J7slK8B5GUuXJHOw.text: Wasn't the best wasn't terrible. Reminded me of a Mexican Applebee's, wouldn't say it was authentic Mexican at all. The complimentary chips were really good, the green avocado salsa was 100x better than the red one that is served at over temperature ? Which i found strange. The server and busboy were friendly enough but they seemed overwhelmed. I ordered a glass of wine and it took about 10-15 minutes to come out. Once it came out there were chunks of cork in it so I sent it back. My second glass of wine didn't come out for at least 15 minutes after that... even our food was already out. I ordered a salad off the "healthy" menu ... but nothing on that menu is actually healthy. The salad was ok - ENORMOUS portion, like I could feed half of the restaurant with it. The chicken on the salad was kind of fatty :/ don't think I'd return...

qvu7CF13BiiYtbhrf1JZUA.text: There was no one to greet us when we got there. xrIaBGJX0CZ4GU1hiJMKFQ.text: Living in both Texas and Las Vegas, we were excited to see Los Cucos open in Las Vegas. We have eaten many times at the restaurants in Texas. While not the greatest Tex-Mex, it is certainly not the worst (at least in Texas). We decided to try the new location off Arroyo Crossing. The restaurant is nice and clean and the service is fast. My wife and I had a sampler plate which contained fairly typical Tex-Mex offerings. Overall, we were quite disappointed. It has little resemblance to the restaurants in the same chain in Texas. The enchilada was without any flavor whatsoever. The refried beans had an unusual texture and taste and were somewhat overdone. The rice was anything but Tex-Mex. The beef fajita meat was actually pretty good. The tortillas were fair. The price though was considerably higher than the same restaurant plates in Texas. While we were hoping for a True Tex-Mex restaurant in Las Vegas, this one missed the mark. The lack of flavor and seasoning were disappointing-- akin to a Mexican TV dinner. Unfortunately, we will not try Los Cucos in Las Vegas again and continue to hope some True Tex-Mex restaurant eventually opens in Las Vegas.

xegbJn3HmatMGipQQm3SZw.text: I was so excited to try this restaurant because we need some real Mexican food here in Las Vegas!  I was finally able to go last night and I was so disappointed!   When we sat down at our table it took 10 mins for the waitress to come over for our drink order then another 10 for the girl to come and bring us some chips and salsa.  She brought us a basket of chip crumbs.   Once the waitress came back with our drink order I asked if we could bring us some chips so we could try the salsa.  She brought us more crumbs.  Disappointing!   You need to have chips and salsa at a Mexican restaurant!!!  Ok now comes the food, there isn't much to select on the menu so I tried the cheese enchiladas.  You really can't mess that up!   Well they bring me something that looks like a corn tortilla topped with salsa.  It was so gross and the beans on the plate looked like they scraped a baby's diaper!    The only thing I could eat was the rice and that was not cooked all they way!   My friend did not complain too much about the Pollo Delmar, but wouldn't recommend it.  Very pricey for the meal.  Needless to say I was very disappointed and would not recommend this place.  The only reason I gave it a 1 cause you have to in order to write a review!!!   Save your money and cook at home!

Mg9MIhz1IKAefjElF9DOsQ.text: One of the best mexican restaurants in Vegas. Their barbacoa really isnt barbacoa though, other than that, the best mexican food around. Great staff, always a great dining experience here, no wonder, they're from Texas !!! El Campo at that !!! I'll give 5 stars when they put real barbacoa out not shredded meat posing as barbacoa. The watermelon drink was F amazing though !!! I went during and had the brunch on Sunday. Any other day i have the enchiladas verdes and its always good.

-EmOaa8gdpPyZCTIxHh9bw.text: Ay caramba!  El Chapo must be in the kitchen cooking because there's no way food this good is legal.  Seriously.  I think I ruined myself for the rest of the Mexican food here in Vegas.  Eight days is how long I lasted in my 2018 NYE resolution.    Armando is our server.  Great guy who came here for the opening with his wife a year ago.  We started off with the Ceviche Cozumel - it's a bit spicy but filling. Armando recommended the Carne Margarita and the Seafood Al Vapor.  When the seafood came out, Armando cut the aluminum wrapping revealing a boiling cornucopia of seafood beneath.    The Carne Margarita was insanely delicious.  Resting on a bed of arroz was a tender fajita buried under a mound of mushrooms and herbs.  Somewhere in that bed of tasty was some Monterey Jack to really tie it together.  Ambiance was clean with Mexican music playing in the background that was neither overpowering conversation or loud.    I highly recommend this place and we will be back.  For brunch - they have a Sunday brunch that is only $16.99.  The ambiance is cozy and clean.

igmpoybIhzbRjG2XWPP3Ww.text: Honestly it's kind of a problem at this point how often I order from here. Do they use in house delivery drivers? Or like grub hub... because it'll be really awkward if they realize how often I'm buying these ridiculously delicious hard shell beef tacos. I can't stop. I'm talking more than once a week people, and my whole family hasn't stopped me because literally everything from here is delicious so it's always a hit. It CAN get a little expensive if you get something other than tacos or burritos / chimichangas, but if you do get the aforementioned items, it's about $10 a person for a ton of really well seasoned, good quality food. mEgjVQf45Shm8Cz-FOF1_Q.text: We found this place on yelp. Since we were close by. We came with no reservations on a Friday a little after 5. The hostess and the main host or maybe manager greeted us with a smile. We waited maybe 5 min or less and they accommodated us and we were 18 people deep!  The server Denis was quick to greet us and bring our drinks out. He took our orders and the food came out in no time. All of our food! Wow. No whining children asking us when the food was coming. I orders the shrimp poblano and it was yummy. It's a big meal. The portions here are big.  They have outdoor patio seating and the atmosphere is friendly.

sQM9eMy65qrtykJ43WDNOw.text: I tried this place based in its 4 star rating and location. It was not terrible but no great  Chips and salsa to start , avocado salsa and a red salsa were flavorful and mild . Chips were obviously made way before they made their way to the table .  I ordered the flauta plate and my friend ordered the chicken enchiladas .  The flautas were over cooked mostly edible , lacked any real flavor . They are accompanied by ranchero beans . This was a version I had never seen. It was like soup and again lacking any flavor .   My friend's enchiladas were mild and okay. Not horrible , not great .  Will I visit again ? No . A person came by and asked how was our food and answered :good ? Right ?  I guess it was a rhetorical question  Come with low expectations

IgX7RCZuaSbeBOLuXBD4EA.text: I was there a week ago, today for my Daughter's 24 Birthday, the food was incredible!!! The server was so attentive!! I will be definitely returning!!

ImihRVaKI2gz8rbc-6Qnhg.text: As soon as I entered into the door, Arlethe greeted me with a very warm and friendly smile. I don't know about everyone else but first impressions mean a lot to me and that was a very nice one. And, it usually tells me everything I need to know about the restaurant but just in case...here's my review for the super burrito that I ordered to go...  First, the wait was not long at all, in spite of a very busy looking place. Sometimes the food can be prefect but if I'm waiting too long, it doesn't matter because my appetite gets upset and makes the perfect food taste bad. Oh, when I arrived, one of the servers was singing. That tells me he was happy and if a server is happy during a rush, then that's another sign of a good place to me. I kind of wish more servers sang while they worked. It seems to promote a good vibe and since restaurants are all about vibes, why not??   The portion size is huge.  Giant burrito.  Chips.  Salsa.  Beans and Rice. Chopped lettuce Guac and Sour Cream.   And, I'm not talking just a spoonful, you get a good bowl of rice and bowl of beans.  For under 15 bucks? That's plenty for one and maybe even enough to feed two.   The taste was delicious. Not over cooked. Not under cooked. Full of flavor stuffed all up inside like a pinata that exploded in my mouth when I took a bite.  Friendly. Fast. And flavorful.   Can yelp make a diamond review for those that exceed 5 star rating? Like hello?? Yelp...is anyone in there??  5 stars easy.

2FT6AAje0tPBqhNKziuJAg.text: It was my first time ordering from this place. Our team at work decided to order dinner here and wanted to have it delivered. They use door dash as their delivery partner. Unfortunately, door dash didn't not have the dessert options on their ordering menu and we really wanted to try their Tres Leches, as it looked really good from the pictures here on Yelp. So we called the restaurant and asked how we can order it, they first said that we have to call door dash. I'm already unhappy with that answer. So I called again and asked if we can just order something that is the same price as the Tres Leches, and they can just make sure that we get the Tres Leches, the hostess passed the phone to someone else, not sure if she was a manager, and she again said that I have to call door dash, and I asked if we can just order something of the same price, and she finally said ok that is fine, just order something that costs $5.99 and place on the notes to substitute the Tres Leches. I was thankful. We went ahead and placed the order and made sure to place the notes and even noted that we have spoken to the restaurant already about it. About 5 minutes after we placed the order, I called again just to make sure that this is executed correctly. The first two calls went straight to voicemail as if they were purposely ignoring my call, then finally, on the third call, a guy answered, different from the girl who answered previously. His name was Allan or something like that. I kindly asked if they have received our order from door dash, he asked for the name, and he said "yes, we did!" I then asked him if they have the Tres Leches order as per requested and talked about, and he said "Yes, we do have your Tres Leches in the order." This has made me happy and confident that my order will come correct as I have confirmed it.  And then the order arrives.... We opened it and the first thing we opened was a box that had coconut covered ice cream in it. At this point we already worried because we did not order any other desserts besides the Tres Leches. And we continued on with opening the rest of the orders, we opened another box which had brownies and churros, great desserts yes, but not something we ordered. Everything else in the bag was exactly what we ordered, EXCEPT there was NO Tres Leches. I am blown away and could not even fathom their thought process of how this happened. How they got everything correct, but the one thing I called for multiple times and had confirmed, was not in our order. But yet, they gave us all these desserts that we did not order. It's as if they did it in purpose.   IT IS NOT OK TO PLAY WITH YOUR CUSTOMERS. TERRIBLE SERVICE!

sMI2kaGSEdWlT8lriXaNfQ.text: New Mexican Restaurant that is different but very good. Ask for their Habanero sauce. It's HOT but has a great flavor. I mixed the habanero with their cilantro crema sauce and YUM!  Definitely one of the most unique around. I ordered the 2 cheese enchilada meal. The red sauce has a little bit of a beef flavor. The beans and rice have great flavor. In all actuality I think this restaurant deserves a 4 1/2 Star rating (I couldn't figure out how to do that). So what is my 1/2 star complaint? Well, I broke both legs a month ago and am wheelchair bound. Went to the restroom and the door is heavy. My husband had to push it open. That's it! My next visit will be on my own two legs. Btw, the bathroom was very clean and fresh smellinf

XMFrdX1hDi5ac89urjn4FA.text: I'm giving it one star because the website says there is all day happy hour on Monday and Tuesday. However, I stopped in this past Monday at 7pm to eat and drink, and was informed they had done away with the all day happy hour awhile back but hadn't changed the website. It's now Wednesday and it still says all day happy hour on their website. This looks like a national chain, so if you're going to make a big change like this, you'd think they would change the website first so people aren't deceived.
