aTa1_6kQQrb6K5gfzqTkKQ.text: Say what! What place has the best salsa dips before the main entree? Los Cucos of course. We dined here for some appetizing Mexican fare at my 5 year old's request after his preschool graduation. First time here, this place was Mimi's Cafe back in the day. While I am sad to see Mimi go, I am thrilled to have finally tried this restaurant. My family and I loved the salsa and the other green dip made up of sour cream, guacamole, and some other tasty ingredients. Lunch specials are awesome sauce! My hubby and I savored the shrimp quesadillas, my mom had chicken fajitas, my mother and father in law had chimichangas, and my kiddos had chicken quesadillas. The portions are generous and we highly enjoyed our meals. We sat in the enclosed outside area perfect if you have kiddos. The service was great too. Can't wait to go back. OLE!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp quesadillas so good!
Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh yea!! Love Los Cucos!!
Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My kiddos chicken qusadillas nom nom!

Gwazqs4wf75RtCNUb8f8dg.text: I wasn't that impressed. People I know always raved about how good the food is there. Maybe the kitchen was having a bad day.    My husband and I went for a late lunch, early dinner. We ordered an appetizer which was their stuffed jalepeno peppers. There was only 2 of them but they were really good.   That's where the good stopped. I ordered the chicken enchilada platter with a taco on side. The taco was so soggy it fell on the floor when I picked it up. The enchiladas were just ok. My husband got a burrito and said it was ok but not what people were raving about. It definitely didn't warrant a trip back.

nacaCjyN98IGEVp-80z3pQ.text: Nacho cheese on everything? YES PLEASE =)  I've been here several times & I still love this place! I was first intrigued when my coworker said they serve warm chips & salsa! What in the world...? So, I had to try it!  Their warm Chips & Salsa is delicious! The green dip it comes with is even more delicious!!!  I've also tried their Chimichanga Plate & the Deep Fried Avocado Plate.  The Chimichanga is my fav!!!! The best part? They drench it with nacho cheese!!!! They also drench their other dishes with nacho cheese (enchilada, burritos, etc).  The restaurant has a warm & welcoming feeling, like I'm dining at a friend's home.   I'd definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A closer look at the Chimichanga Plate (with ground beef)
Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chimichanga Plate (with ground beef)
Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep Fried Avocado w/ ground beef

zUDgEp_siD96q6Gkwylk_g.text: The servings are always generous and the ingredients are fresh. I highly recommend the beef fajita nachos, which never disappoint.  The manager, Alan, does a great job being attentive to customers, and always greets you at the door with a smile.

DMfLo76vZOGiyKHzaWxYUg.text: Woah ok.  If you have been blessed to partake of real Tex-Mex in Texas then you know Los Cucos is a safe bet.  In Texas they are honorary members of the Holy Tex-Mex trinity.  Papasitos, Ninfas, and Los Cucos.  Out here in Vegas Los Cucos is the Holy Trinity.    The food is incredible.  You have to order their Beef fajitas. It is a Texas staple. You haven't lived until you've enjoyed a sizzling platter.  The service is wonderful. The on duty manager always makes his rounds to ensure your experience with the Texan way, great service and even better food.    Oh and prices are great. They are in line with what you get. Just a heads up...fajitas for one will feed about 2 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This menu is missing from heaven.

21ehdIIMxWf6Hq-pIzASUA.text: We love coming here. My fave is stuffed avocado with steak. It's filling and I jus get it with the beans and rice.  Drinks are cold and refreshing and the service is excellent.

UTuj5FQUe2NPQAAuZHnVDg.text: I've been wanting to try this restaurant and when I received a coupon in the mail for buy one entree get a 2nd entree for 50% off I was excited. When I showed them the coupon they said it was for brunch only. This makes zero sense because it says in fine print on the coupon it's for an entree of equal or lesser value and the brunch is a set price. The coupon says NO WHERE that it is for brunch only. They mention their brunch in the ad, but it is no where on the coupon. If they intended it to be for brunch only then they need to fire their designer or marketing person. They put out a coupon to get people in and then don't accept it?! Not a good business practice.  The menu was full of colorful Mexican food with some unique flavors that I hadn't seen before, but it was poorly organized and slightly overwhelming. Plus the food was priced too high for my liking.  The food was decent but the service was awful. There was hardly anyone in the restaurant and it took us like 20 minutes to get the check after we finished and no one cleared our plates.  I was really disappointed first by the coupon then by the service. I will not be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full coupon- NO WHERE does it say coupon is for brunch only

vxxGWpmVOkpqpV8l7KTKgQ.text: Where do I begin?  The welcome was warm and inviting.... friendly. Then the chips came with 2 kinds of salsas. I am a bit confused. They're American Cantina chips. Where's the authentic deep fried tortilla chips???? Negative 5 points. The salsas were mediocre. I didn't taste the authenticity of the flavors.   Now, many will rant like crazy about me:"you're Asian, what do you know about Mexican food?" Let me tell you to--PAUSE, hold on to your tas-tas, and let me finish my review. When you grow up in TACO FLATS USA-California, your expectations are set high. Why? Because Juan, Jose & Maria's grandma used to do a lot of Latin foods. You definitely could even go to Sal's little taco stand and receive the best Buche taco and never looked at it any differently. Yes, be spontaneous and allow yourself to go balls deep into trying everything once.... enough said. Muchas Gracias!   Pros:  Great customer service  Big portions for what you pay for Open bar Family friendly  Clean  Cons:  Lack of authenticity in Latin flavors  Chips-cantina style Steak over cooked (ordered med. rare) Salsas lacked flavor  #chipotlebeatsLosCucos worst part..... I HATE CHIPOTLE FRANCHISE.... I am all about small joint places and support local businesses!   So, I warned you.   You're welcome.

wBB0BmL7o2aD2cApGRDsdA.text: My new favorite restaurant Mexican restaurant! They toook the 3 most incredible things, AVOCADO, chicken, cheese and deep fried it. Should i stop there? We did the create your own 2 items i got tje avo ball and steak quesadilla was sooo good both! The steak was so flavorful, slightly greasy but probably due to the cheese. Only $8.99 and enough food to make 2 meals. The rice was also different and tasty had corn bits in it. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed avocado soooo good
Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o0ICY9RT8BwokDhJfrKHgw.text: Delicious authentic Mexican food and great service! I had the carnitas and I highly recommend them. Not fatty and not skimpy on the chunk sizes. My hubby had the ceviche aguachile which was very spicy but he couldn't stop eating it. We'll definitely be back ;-)

qejp7u1twVREftejmUCl6w.text: Omar is an excellent waiter. The food is what is prime here. Authentic flavors and big plates. Ceviche is a must here. Margaritas are on point.

ds998W9MGcXTP74IQatN-Q.text: After a long day of shopping and errands we were hungry and wanted some good Mexican food. This restaurant was located in the back of the parking lot but we spotted it as we were leaving ROSS. I'm not one to try new restaurants without doing my research first but this place was AMAZING! Best decision of the day. The staff was very welcoming, big smiles. The drink selection was amazing. The Menu had A LOT of options and the prices were very good. The atmosphere of the restaurant overall was very clean, bright, and beautiful colors, the lighting, music, and entertainment (tvs) were all very on point. Our waitress was the sweetest and helped us choose what to order. The FOOD let me tell you was probably the best Mexican food I've ever had at a restaurant, I've had real traditional homemade Mexican food before and going to Mexican restaurants in America is always a gamble to see how good it is. This place hands down was just AMAZING! AMAZING SERVICE, FOOD, EVERYTHING!!!!! Highly Recommended!!!

W1j5AhhS4r085-htwvL4_g.text: Very disappointing. The search for good hispanic food continues.. food was mediocre and missing flavor. Service was a bit slow but they are friendly. The place is cute and has good lighting.

OdEC3-ZAYmeF7kpN0W_ZAQ.text: The staff was very nice, we were seated quickly. They took our order, food came out quick and food was good. We ordered several different plates, smothered burrito, rolled tacos, steak salad and some ceviche. Make sure if your seated out in the sun room area that sun isn't hitting you in the face

MqrJplDCV4XyMwfWmgS5Bw.text: The Sunday Breakfast buffet was amazing! Hands down the best breakfast restaurant I've had in a while. Will come back for sure.  Make sure you're hungry because they have everything you can imagine in a Mexican breakfast plus more. Omelettes made to request, fresh tortillas, beans, rice, menudo, ceviche, cereal and all types of desserts. They had unlimited aguas frescas and pan dulce!!I can't wait for Sunday.

NgdGke2K-nV1mXb7ax2QwQ.text: Not your run-of-the-mill Mexican restaurant.  You'll have a hard time making a decision on what to order.  Plus, it is rare where the dish that arrives at your table actually looks better than the picture in the menu!  Guacamole made tableside and you customize it.  So fresh and tasty.   Can't wait to return.  Tomorrow?

Kzwa-Wsi6PNt0zXSk0OiqQ.text: Went there on a Friday night and the service was great and food was amazing. My boyfriend left his sunglasses there and Arlette was there the next day to give them back. Thank you for your honesty integrity and amazing food

sX-TDeKlmEWOALKeWcsfJQ.text: Great music good food...definately returning Had me dancing in my seat and the watermelon margarita was delicious....

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uyaDdV5WDURrxQ2CyfJULQ.text: This is definitely a Must place to visit!!! Food was delicious!! And the service is awesome!! Our waiter Eloisa was the best!! Super nice!! And I loved the fact that the manager Manny stop by to see how everything was!! Very friendly guy!! And super nice! Great food! Great service! Definitely coming back!!

OBG85H5Ybf46mJRLi-L75Q.text: Great food and great service every time we come here. Denis was especially helpful today as our server. I recommend eating at Los Cucos!

SY9LKN0Q6fSDj-ejMNa3XA.text: Excellent service by Lupita she was so friendly and very helpful. The food beat our expectations. Fish tacos made with homemade tortillas were mouth watering. The Delicioso was delicioso! The size of the gulf shrimp were huge. Expect to take home left overs. We had the regular large margaritas and they were perfect. We were told they are $5.00 for happy hour Monday thru Friday. This is a Texas restaurant chain and happy it's the first in Vegas. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

flIuG2hVgfF9IXcXCttE6A.text: Love this place.. the guacamole by the table is the best! The service is really great too!

eTJIjDvhuQnc6uEdrCC7Sw.text: My favorite Mexican food place. The Sunday brunch I can't wait for Sundays. Totally recommend this place.

TS_zUMFLYmNx6GcRPowcSg.text: The food here is excellent! After started our meal the manager even came by to check and see how we were doing. I had a chimichanga and I think it was one of the best things I've had in a very long time.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that it wasn't the cleanest place. We were sitting in a booth and the wall with the tile needs to be cleaned very badly. It was gross with old bits of food.  Other than that one thing, the service was great and so was the food.

BJyRgXHLbPfyjRoOdi-5aA.text: Beef fajitas WOW!! The meat was so tender and full of flavor! Margaritas are really good too! They have a Sunday brunch as well, that i havent tried yet but looks good and is offered at a good price as well.  I will definately go back!!

kMUnbPA1VKKW4eGAP5E8mQ.text: I'll admit, I didn't know what to expect... food was solid!! I appreciate the bravado to roll up hard on Chili's, which has dominated that location since it opened. The building is tucked away in the corner, a mere reminder of the businesses past... don't let that discourage you. Good authentic Mexican food if that is what you are looking for, not the Fresh Mex Corporate conglomerate. Get the Filet Mignon with the crab stuffed shrimp and you won't be disappointed!!

jKDEA_fXFhaMgFMfiU9lUw.text: Went there for my Granddaughter birthday. It was grand opening and was crowded..service was good food was as well. I would recommend it to friends. Staff was very friendly.

uTN81pJ6vZ6x9d1OXPJUBA.text: The minute we walked in I felt so exposed with the bright lights and loud atmosphere.  It was almost like a diner feeling, instead of the Mexican ambiance we are used to.  I decided to look past my first impression and stay.  However, I quickly noted that we should have gone elsewhere.  Our server took 15 minutes to greet us and was not very helpful when it came time to explaining the differences in the margaritas.  I loved the colored pictures on the menu, if only our actual food reflected them though.  My fajita meat was 2-3 inches thick and did not have the flavor or texture of the meat I'm used to being served on a sizzling platter. And no, for the record,  there was no sizzle here, folks.  I think the highlights were my watermelon margarita and their Birthday song for our daughter.  We quickly figured when you hear the bell ring, someone, somewhere is about to be sung to.  Hope they can work out the kinks before they sink.

b7_9NLEB9q0k-3rtjYEJjg.text: Craving fajitas we decided to check this place out.  The food was ok, I ordered the sizzling shrimp fajitas, they definitely sizzled from the moment they came out causing me and others, not dining with us, to cough from smoke and peppers!  The atmosphere is coffee shop style and really, really, really loud!  So if you are looking for a quiet dinner out this is not the place.  Looking for a fun meal with the family, friends, or the kiddos this is the place.

kM2RIt2V-xRhL6dK8bSp0Q.text: Food was not tasty. Rice and Beans were dry and old.  Over priced for such poor quality food. Could've gotten a better enchilada at Robertos.

kEVYkxQoVICRWF100EKpOg.text: I'm visiting my grandparents in Vegas and we were looking for a good Mexican restaurant. I yelped this place and saw the reviews were good so we decided to give it a try.  Let me just say - this place is AMAZING!!! I got the stuffed avocado with beef.  OMG! Absolutely delicious! My grandma got the same thing with shrimp in it and loved it. My mom got the same thing with only cheese. She loved it as well! The soup is DELICIOUS! The homemade flour tortillas are amazing too!!! My grandparents are so happy they found a great Mexican restaurant nearby! When we are back in Vegas next time we will be coming back here! I highly recommend this restaurant! This is coming from a girl that lives in Orange County, California! With no shortage of great Mexican restaurants around.  Oh I almost forgot, the chips are delicious and their avocado salsa is to die for!!!!!

L9mS_Aph8z83zSfgZLXNUg.text: This is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. The food here is so good. It is so authentic. The flavors just meld together. The manager and waiters are extremely nice and personable. I have been here twice and will continue to return.  My sister-in-law had the mango margarita and it was huge, she said it was so good. I have had the shrimp quesadillas and the Del Mar and both are excellent meals.

HRcftKLnYjtL028UXDe3Kg.text: Salsa is AMAZING! Micheladas are a must try. Service was great. Will be coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

W8YzPVgNppQO0Fy5MFkRng.text: Did someone say Taco Bell or Del Taco? Please get me out of here and take my food back as this place is horrible. The chips are stale and the red salsa must have came out of the microwave or something because the temperature was hot as I am not talking about how spicy it is. A avocado salsa tastes like who knows what but it was no good. Chipotle and QDOBA grill are much better choices in the area if you have a hankering for Mexican.

aBusRbO3HZt1HGR5f2csWg.text: Nice sit-down alternative to the taco shop type Mexican that is ubiquitous in Las Vegas valley (I'm looking at you, Roberto's and Don Tortaco). To start they give you generous portions of chips and their two salsas which I've found not so common since moving here. Menu prices are a bit high but the potion sizes are reflective (we ended up with a box to take home). The restaurant was clean. Food took a good while to come out but the servers were attentive and took notice when it seemed to be taking too long. Steak for fajitas was well seasoned. And tamales weren't dry at all. Beans had great flavor. Even my kids' meals were delicious when I sampled them and the portions were very generous.

VygiQLiJTDatOKOu5h6Gsw.text: Loved the Service and how quick the food came out - Michelada was yummy . Always on top of our drinks being refilled. Went with the family ( everyone was satisfied and full) Next - Girls night  for happy hour!

IbjDnhNoys7ovk6FbA6Gcg.text: I was really excited for this place till we ate here, its way overpriced we waited over 20 minutes for a drink and at least another 30 minutes for our food that had absolutely no flavor, and it wasnt busy at the time either.

AvWGBsFIv8uCJ-Duz_lU6w.text: We've been looking for a new Mexican spot to go to and we came across this spot. I've operated food & beverage outlets in major strip properties, nightlife and gaming. I know the difference between exceptional service and unacceptable. I rarely give reviews or ask to speak to a manager since I hardly get wowed.   Last night I got wowed, our server Victor did an exceptional job from greeting, following up after a couple bites, suggestive selling us a dessert.. all with a smile. Great kid  The food was very good, packed with flavor. I suggest the Mexican Bowl and my fiance was very pleased with her enchiladas..which she ate the leftovers this afternoon and still delicious.  For those of you that review restaurants, spend some time in a kitchen or work the floor to give your review any sort of merit.   We've all had out bad nights, speak with the manager first before you bash them on social media or yelp. Give them the opportunity to fix it, then again we live in a passive aggressive society. If you don't have the guts to speak to a manager, send them an email.   Base your decision if they respond or not.

rTmlYtHBKtvA53wQKWr4Sw.text: Omg...yum! I'm from Cali and the Mexican food there can't be compared. I've been looking for some bomb Mexican food in LV and could not find it. I stumbled across this place and now I'm a True fan. The atmosphere was casual and cool, the live mariachi was great and the food was amazeballs. The price kinda took my breath away at first but we were all seated and I didnt want to be "that" person who snuck out the door, but let me tell you... it was worth it. The portions huge (had a ton of leftovers) and the flavor delish. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. The margarita was potent ;) Try it. You wont be disappointed!

LJLVlsHN1LI1hurdfDPfqw.text: My server ASIA was amazing. Exceptional service and very entertaining. She works so hard to make this restaurant the best. I loved the appetizers and happy hour specials especially the margaritas you have to try them.  The carne asada is very flavorful and this restaurant has music too! I love this place and it just opened.  If you enjoy a hot authentic Mexican meal here is the place.

7k9XjC-opV4QoJgFGwaxjQ.text: Best place in Vegas for Mexican food! There steak and shrimp fajitas are to die for!! Great drinks and even flan..our waitress was Luz, she made our experience great. Very attentive and nice. Will be back!!!

a7eecO9JezEB1ZZpub_IaQ.text: I just tried it for the first time.  I had the same lunch special Rita A. did with the shrimp, rice and steak fajita rollup.  $10.  Homemade tortillas.  Everyone was super friendly and it's a decent atmosphere.  There's even a neat little sun room/enclosed patio in the front.  I'd definitely go back.

PLY47NjtsvygC2_odtlYog.text: The service wasn't great, but the real kicker here is the food. I got a chimichanga that was topped with the unmistakable taste of cheese wiz. Disgusting. And that was just my food. Entire party disliked their plates. Will never go here again.

qLzJcNCb85mIlwW4yFsG2A.text: Gross and flavorless...except the fajitas, those are amazing. The staff is phenomenal too. If they put the same effort into everything else as they do the fajitas they would be one of the best in the city.

njz6aKlug8A6777JkJ26xg.text: Not bad. I ordered the fajitas, but found them to be far too salty tasting to my liking. I had tacos here last week and they were decent. Their guacamole is fantastic and a huge portion. Not sure if I'd go back again, but if I did....it's for an order of Guacamole to go :)

ShhnNUtTPFeVjKyUHfGL9A.text: The service was ok and the food was just so-so.  We actually really wanted to like this place because it would be great to have a good Mexican restaurant near by...however no one in our party sees a reason to return.

qKkDbEBw1k_WovA7AzPzhA.text: This is by far the best Mexican food I have had in Las Vegas EVER!! I had fajitas de poblano - YUM - rice is terrific!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K0WH9hwscZPjWT3823h8dw.text: Been waiting for this place to open...to our surprise not bad at all. Their food has a lot of flavors. I ordered the Mexican bowl (rice, beans, veggies, fajita chicken) with two different salsa...the tomatillo green salsa is sour and spicy(its great). My husband ordered El Gringo which comes with rice, beans, salad, enchelada, tacos, fajita beef with fresh flour tortilla.  Both of our meats were tasty and have a lot of flavors. The only thing negative I can say is that the fresh flour tortilla gets hard so fast and my husband says that his beef was a little dry other than that It was great. I recommend all of you to try it. The staff are super friendly and attentive . Give it a go!

e1K40H_i-ll5DRaKKB7AcQ.text: I wish I could give 1 star but I can not.. couple off things   1. There is a lady that walks around and offers guacamole like it's free ... it's not it's actually 9 dollars and horrible too may I add   2. Ordered a tamale and a ground meat taco. I got a cheese enchilada and a chicken taco.. witch was pretty much the worst I've ever ate   3. I watched the bus boy wipe a seat off then wipe a table off with the same towel I didnt think that was sanitary.  I will never return again I will make the extra 5 minute drive to flaming fajitas

YROoyW7ag0GMQEahNuCuOw.text: The filet mignon with stuffed shrimp was delicious and so were the Enchiladas verdes. The red salsa they bring with the chips is amazingggg....Oh and don't let me forget mango drink....yum yummm

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon and stuffed shrimp

PT0n5mAivWsajoE89CHDXw.text: I came here the other night with my family, very excited to try a new restaurant. I am sooo disappointed. The service was great, waiters and waitresses were very friendly however the food left much to be desired. Coming from a Latino family I have high expectations for Mexican/Latino establishments and I would rate this place on the same level as Taco Bell. The refried beans definitely came from a can, had the consistency of cement and had no flavor whatsoever, not even any cheese and the rice was severely dry and under-seasoned. The dishes that were supposed to have cheese in them either had no cheese or were smothered velveeta, GROSS. All food the food was bland and to be quite honest, all 7 in attendance for dinner there last night feel sick afterwards. The prices are too high for what you actually get, all in all, super disappointed

vriZnl9THfPMJKx7WTzRAA.text: This new restaurant is great. We have been looking for a great Mexican restaurant to enjoy on a regular basis. Largely it seems every one of them around town is exactly the same. The same menu and offerings, just might have a different name. This is not the case with Los Cucos. The menu is great and has many great offerings. We love the food. The service is okay, mainly because our second time there it seemed the server was super new and things did not come out as expected, but the manager jumped in and made it all good. They have a mariachi band that goes around. The first time we went we sat out of the glassed in patio. It was a really cool space. I assume they will rent it out, because it would be a neat space for a party. Our whole family loves the place and we will definitely keep coming back.

hYBaRF6KhBhgjlohUN90uA.text: I don't think Edgar the server liked us at all. He probably just saw two Asian people and thought we were gonna stiff him . My food was cold but he never came to check on us. I tipped the busser more money cause she was way more attentive .

Drc_DpLblJvDdWbAeieXYA.text: The Wife and I have been there 3 times in the last month. I get steak and chicken fajitas...best I've had, ever!

kYmmY_odbSfD-bYcWJ34tw.text: I'm very sad to leave 1 star but here is my reasoning. After 3 trips to this restaurant, food was great and service was even better every time. However tonight I ordered chicken fajitas and as I was eating I took a bite that had steel wire in it from what appeared to be a dishwashing brush. I notified the manager and he handled it the best he could but something like this can't be forgotten. Hours later I can still feel the pain in my mouth.

67jU4PzQ_TZHbu9PB3l6-w.text: Came for the first time and was really amazed with the service we were given. Working in customer service, it's always appreciated. The food was amazing, the drinks were strong, and our server gave us the best customer service. Victor was our server and he was excellent! Definitely coming again!

9JTgLCamcRkWEx-iWzs5QA.text: I'm so disappointed. This place came highly recommended, but we didn't enjoy it. The fajita meat was very salty and they only have Tabasco for hot sauce. The staff was pleasant enough, but the food left much to be desired.

5MvlQDbX8j-vYXT-zUaOow.text: Love the food and the service. Their margaritas are delicious also. A little pricey but good!

xomOa-I9YtCvo_vXOEVjBA.text: I moved to Las Vegas from Houston 8 years ago. I have been praying for a real Texas Mexican restaurant to come to Vegas since I've moved here.  Well, Las Vegas finally hit the jackpot!  My favorite Houston Mexican restaurant has branched out to Las Vegas!   Los Cucos brought the original Tejas flavor to the west coast. The fajitas are tender, hot, and juicy just like I remember them.  The tortillas are hot, fluffy, and fresh.  The salsa is served hot, not cold like the typical restaurants in the desert.  The stuffed avocado is decadent!  The margaritas are the best into town!  Order a frozen with a Chambord shot...you won't be disappointed.   The management and staff are the best.   The manager, Jesus, makes you feel welcome like you're at a family gathering on Christmas holiday.  Bottom line, I've been dreaming that this day would come.  It finally has!  Give this place a try. You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AXLh0utAGWkZuarrW8SDRA.text: This place was fantastic! Second time coming here and it was as good as the first time. I don't know how they marinade and cook their beef, but it literally the best ever. It's so tender and juicy! It's definitely my top recommendation when it comes to quality Mexican food.

RKp1i7wZH1Pzujwo7eGZlw.text: First off there's no music so you get to hear the servers flirting with each other the bartenders swearing and saying Jesus if you times and basically everything that's going on in the back of the house. Second service was terrible the bus or asked me how my meal was but the server walked by me four times without asking anything which was irritating because my guacamole had a huge chunk of avocado in it so it wasn't guacamole it was just avocado. Finally food was not worth it at all I thought this was going to be authentic Mexican food but it's closer to chilies Mexican than Lindo Michoacan. Rice was also Cold

Dl6tbjseJdQAp_wHzfIOhw.text: Was so excited to see a new Mexican restaurant in the southwest but to my disappointment this place totally missed the mark.  No atmosphere, medicore service, poor food quality and extremely overpriced.   I can go to Cafe Rio or Chipotle for a much better price and taste.

fEQzDE23jRP8cMhZ9BV9FA.text: Just moved to town and this was our first stop while looking for a new "go to" Mexican restaurant. This was a hit. All five of us loved everything we had. We will be back--for sure. Our waiter Jose was spot on; food was timely and seating was timely.  ***UPDATE*** So I've gone back now for a third time and have had a different meal every time. They have all been fantastic!  I can not get enough of the food here, it's awesome. They also have a side of pickled carrots and jalapenos, I have to have them--they are a perfect fit with every meal--I crave them. We have never had a bad meal and the service is top notch. We've never waited more than 3 mins for a table and the wait staff is on time and courteous all the time. Even if you don't make this your regular place at least check it out once--you'll be back!

0M5OZG7A12Q0SJvuD5ZvsQ.text: I've been a frequent to this place and I do have to say that they have some bomb asf food. The waiters are always so nice and have a smile and if they end up messing up on accident totally understandable they offer to remake the food and pay for it which is the kindest thing. In conclusion Los Cucos Mexican Cafe in my opinion is my favorite Mexican place to go to which says a lot.

I7Y4L5e515sYYh8xLgwPMQ.text: Place is awesome. Been here several times and it doesnt disappoint. So apparently I need to write more...

3RubgUBroc4wpbW6lAE9pw.text: First off, this is the worst rating I've ever given. The experience was shit from beginning to end. My buddies who live there sit at the bar once a week and I've gone several times and things were fine. We went Thursday June 6 around 7pm and sat at the bar. There were 3 other ppl for the bartender to take care of but it took her 8-10 minutes to greet us and bring us chips & Salsa (which was hot) and take our drink order.     I ordered the El Gringo and told her NO RABBIT FOOD no lettuce or tomatoes anywhere on the plate. She didn't write our order down so I don't know if it was her or the kitchen but when she brought it it had lettuce and tomatoes all over.    I pointed it out and expected her to use her brain and just go get me a different taco but before I knew it she'd picked up my plate and was gone.   5 minutes later I get my plate back and my fajitas and enchiladas are now cold and the taco has been scraped of everything including the cheese which I wanted.  I asked her to bring me some chz and she acts like I asked for her kidney. She's the one incompetent at her job and now I'm getting attitude and crappy cold food.  I end up paying $63 for a horrible night out plus I left her a tip which I regret doing but I'm too nice. I was up all night sick as well but I don't know if it was the food or not. Needless to say I can't imagine going back to this place. If my friends rlly want to eat there I'll just eat prior and have a margarita which was the only decent part of the meal.   I don't recommend this place at all!!

-JsM1jo78SRFc_Edzw5jsA.text: Came here with a group of 12.  Everyone liked the food, service and prices except me.  I wasn't impressed with the Bloody Mary or my meal of Chili Rellenos. GbOCT5wey09PTBQv7ouTAw.text: Amazing Tex-Mex! This place has the best green and red salsa in the world! Everything on the menu is delicious. I especially love the fajitas, pollo poblano, and stuffed avocado.

g8SsPRh50m2cVDU6zYUHEg.text: I went this evening to meet some friends. The service was great, very friendly and attentive. The food was good, however the when the food arrived at the table the plates where hot, this is a dead give away that a restaurant uses a microwave. This kind makes me weary when a restaurant does that, but over all the food was decent. I ordered the grilled chicken quesadillas with black beans. The presentation was a little messy, but overall the taste was good. I also ordered the gold strawberry margarita, that was very good. Not to sweet and just the right amount of tequila. I would definitely go back for lunch, and try a different dish.

biHpWw5OOqSBpRAiRD1MRg.text: So I've been to Los Cucos about 4 times and on this recent visit we found the cilantro dip to taste different. It didn't seem fresh at all and we could all tell.   The food was just okay this time but not as good as our other visits so I'm updating my review. Also since we had a child with us, he was served uncooked French fries with his quesadilla. This was not only gross and unacceptable, I was disturbed that a kitchen would send this out.  Also, since we went around lunch time and was a party of 5, we ended up sitting in a walkway near the kitchen. This makes the experience less enjoyable in my opinion. There were many other places we could have been seated.  I'm not sure when we will be taking the trip to try Los Cucos again after this experience or recommending it with all the other Mexican food options in Vegas.

GcUlKl6bvcIocEVoUfIivw.text: Horrible customer service and experience. Arrived to two hosts who barely acknowledges you. One of them mumbled something; so I said excuse me ? She asked if my daughter wanted a kids menu. Ok she may be 5' and looks young but she's 18 yrs of age. I decline and we walk to our table. Family seated but I leave to go use restroom and check out bar area; then return to table. I view menu advise family what to order for me. I then head to bar to get a drink; bartender talking to another employee as she sees me waiting. Walks over only after a waiter needs assistance; then after she helps him acknowledged me. Less than 5 mins so I'm thinking ok; maybe her CS skills aren't that great hopefully the food is better. They sit two more tables and takes their order before ours; assuming our table is waiting for another person since I was at the bar. Waiter argues saying we didn't say anything and thought we were waiting for one more person; instead of asking us. Ask to speak to manager and she says it was probably "confusion". Communication is key when dealing with the public. Why would you not acknowledge us and inquire instead of assuming and helping others who came in after. At first I thought the hosts and bartender may need a little CS training but it seems as if their entire staff needs CS training from host - bartender- waiter and manager; they seem to be confused and not the customers.  It's unfortunate because we only got to taste their chips which was ok so I can review their food. We walked out and it didn't seem as if they cared.

tPrhmAsBt0eVWfsMmDlyOQ.text: Another terrific lunch here. Gallitos fish was fantastic. Butter, garlic and fresh jalapeno was so good.

We both agreed that the shrimp poblano was better than the previous times.   The service was great! Our server, Antonio, made sure our waters were always full to the brim and never empty. Very attentive and helpful! The manager came out twice, making sure we were taken care of and making sure everything was good! Very much appreciated!!  Music is always on point here.   Highly recommended :)

iLt3odrPiR-Dg566V0Mv2g.text: I wanted somewhere to stop for dinner on the way home from UNLV and I chose Los Cucos from a search on Yelp.  The restaurant was busy, but I was seated promptly.  A server came and asked about drinks and I ordered my standard iced tea.   I was intrigued by their deep fried stuffed avocado and I decided to try that.  It's a large platter of food.  While waiting for dinner, I enjoyed the chips and salsas.  The tomato based salsa is warm when served and has a small tang to it.  The other is totally different.  It's sour cream, avocado, cilantro, jalapeno, and garlic.  It's quite different and it was good.    After a longer wait than I expected, my meal was brought.  The food was mostly lukewarm.  Since the tortilla soup--also lukewarm-- is served as part of the dinner platter, the food has more chance to lose temperature as you eat the soup.  I'd much rather have the soup served hot as a separate starter than have it lumped on a plate with my main meal.  The stuffed avocado was very good.  The chicken inside had a good flavor and the breading on the avocado was fairly light and crunchy.  The rest of the dish was below average.  The refried beans were very dry, and the fajita taco was covered with chile con queso that tasted like it was melted Cheez Whiz.    Service was lacking.  I asked my server for some sweetener.  He evidently forgot.  After trying to get his attention for about 5 minutes, I asked one of the bus people and I got the sweetener.  Another bus person refilled my iced tea the first time.  My server just walked by.  Later, he put a number of small napkins on the table.  I really have no reason for doing so as they have cloth napkins.  I'd rather have drink refills and sweetener than a number of cocktail sized napkins.  The best part of the meal was dessert.  The tres leches cake was excellent!  It's disheartening when you leave a restaurant thinking of just one course and dismissing the rest.  There will not be a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches cake with toasted marshmallow topping.
Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra napkins for?

s3gluiv8S9gZWjuy5_J1vA.text: I've been here a few times before, and have rarely had an issue, but they weren't really on their game yesterday. The ladies room was completely out of toilet paper for over an hour (yes, I mentioned it to someone), my chips and queso weren't very good (the first thing I've had here that wasn't amazing), the queso tasted like velveeta and rotel and the chips appeared to fried flour tortillas. They were very greasy. My husband had to ask for his drink twice, and it never got refilled. My daughter also accidentally spilled her drink. The server saw it, and walked away. I assumed for a rag/towel/mop/napkins, but no. He never even acknowledged it all. We cleaned it up the best we could with cloth napkins (which are nowhere near absorbent).  I will definitely go back, I love the food (except the queso) and I always have a great experience, but I'll make sure I don't have this server next time.

_W39yXI36bm7Jer3L3uVZA.text: So so yummy! We are visiting Vegas from IN and decided to rent a car to go out to the mountains and found Los Cucos on the way. We weren't sure what to expect but were pleasantly surprised! Very clean, great service, and delicious food. It's a very diverse menu with things we had never heard of! The start by bringing 2 types of salsa, my favorite was the avocado salsa. Creamy and refreshing! We also got a chili cob queso appetizer that comes with warmed, fried pita chips. Delcious! 2 of us got the chicken stuffed avocado which was so different than anything we have had before! It comes with a small cup of chicken tortilla soup which was TO DIE FOR. The other two with us got chimichangas and liked those as well. Even the rice and beans that come with each meal were something special, not like the typical canned refried beans you get at most Mexican restaurants. Highly recommend!!!

UlsIkdjCJWtPsMpAcLdQWA.text: Great chips, great green and red salsa, great and friendly service, great food (way better than other Mexican restaurants that USED TO BE good in town).  My only criticism would be the cocktails tasted like they were virgin cocktails, but hey, everyone's palette is different. . 5 stars!

8-p3djPGVr-9fZwWR7BPLw.text: The quality of the food has declined from previous times. The beans tasted like they were from a can and refried with lots of oil. The enchiladas part of the tortillas were hard some of the meat looked dry and old.  I was not impressed. customer service was ok.  But  I'm not be going back.

QAp5W4fmpBkf-7RxfCyAXQ.text: I've been here a handful of times and ordered to go a handful more. The food is always good and consistent which has kept me coming back. The bar service has been very poor the last two times I've come in. The previous time I sat on the right side of the bar on a week night and although the bar was not full, I was completely ignored and had to flag the bartender down several times to be helped. On my latest visit, I sat near the well hoping to get better service. I was acknowledged this time because my location demanded it but the service was still poor. I ordered from the menu for my to go ordered and had a margarita while I waited. About 25 minutes later, I was still waiting for my food so I asked for the bill so that I could leave as soon as my food was ready. I noticed one of the menu items on the bill was less expensive than it was on the menu so I mentioned it to the bartender. She was unaware of a menu item and proceeded to tell me they didn't have what I was asking for. I told her that I was sure they did because I had pointed to it when I ordered. I showed her on the menu and she told me they didn't have that so I said "so is the menu wrong?" She said she'd get a manager, another server came by and confirmed my suspicion, that they did in fact have what I ordered. He went to the kitchen to have it corrected. The bartender made no apologies. She could tell I was frustrated but just ran my card. I get it, servers/bartenders make mistakes, I've served myself so I understand. Apologize, smile and fix your mistake that's the best way to save the interaction. Better yet, be friendly and attentive to every customer and then if and when a mistake happens, your patrons will be more patient and understanding. I want to like this place because the food is good but I can't justify coming back if the service is disappointing.

gx8r8030zh1NZSNb4YMj_A.text: Stars are mainly for food quality-   Great selection of food, but everything taste bland. Still would come back, but expect mass produced food with little or no seasoning. Wish everything tasted great instead of tasting okay. Drinks are good tho- can't go wrong with a michelada. Very filling with their portions, but rather eat food that hits your cravings, this place doesn't. Feel like I'm eating at a cafeteria somewhere

7MbmAvIyI2Biey279BsP2g.text: The best chicken fajitas ever!!  The pieces of chicken are so big and tender and tastes great.  You will definitely have leftovers.  Even the sides that come with the fajitas are excellent. Los Cucos is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas and that says a lot coming from me since I am known to be quite picky.

gbL178hjYDlqCpRVyCaicw.text: Amazing New Mexican spot just off the 215/Rainbow. The Stuffed Avocado is off the charts!

w513DNI8Tj6lDV96rhS7JA.text: Moving to LV from Texas 12 years ago one of the things I've missed the most was good Tex-mex. When I saw the sign that Los Cucos was coming I was so excited. I have eaten at their Katy Tx. location several times and am a huge fan. For months I anxiously waited for them to open, telling all of my friends how amazing it was compared to all of the other Mexican places here. I have eaten there 4 times since they have opened, each time with a different person and every time they tell me how right I was.  On each occasion I've ordered different things and each time they come out fresh, hot and perfectly seasoned. The warm chips and red and green salsas are so delicious and truly addicting. The queso with beef fajita meat makes you want to lick the bowl. They have great lunch specials with huge portions and the stuffed avocado is sublime. They have a great chicken dish that is covered in a mushroom wine sauce that will make you dream about the next time you can get there to have it again. Everyone I bring here can't get over how awesome the fajita meat is. It's so tender and seasoned to perfection. I know some people are not fans of Tex- Mex and that's okay you can keep your Lindo and  Leticias, all of my friends and I will be at Los Cucos!

7jiRwkF5CL7DNeDSj12U0w.text: Again, Dennis was an awesome waiter. Ask for him and you wont be disappointed. Food was excellent and the Mariachis were so enjoyable. Sorry if I didnt spell that correctly. Thank you!  Happy Sinco de Mayo!

fYYWy9D5mBMbvgwB8etQ5w.text: First time in for dinner tonight w/ the fam.  My husband and I ordered the octopus seafood cocktail and the shrimp fajitas for two.  The seafood cocktail sauce tasted like canned tomato sauce w/ a weird red oily sauce on top, not really feeling it.  The shrimp fajitas were ok but had too much of a spicy tomato based sauce going on, thank goodness for the side of guacamole to help mask the flavor.  The worst was the rice and beans that come w/ the fajitas, just terrible.  The rice literally tasted like instant rice, like Spanish Rice-a-Roni or Knorr.  The rice was too dry and the flavor just wasn't there for the rice or the beans.  My son ordered the cheeseburger on the kid's menu and part of his bun came out really hard, kinda like when you try & microwave a frozen piece of bread for too long.  I know its a Mexican restaurant so I should of known better than to order him a cheeseburger but he's 4 and was dead set on getting a burger.  Our bill was just under $80 (including drinks & tip).  Service was good but the food was a no go for us to visit again.

iobjw7JDbXelMOuc7f0l4A.text: If you want some good Mexican food than this is the place to go! We go here once a week now we love it that much! The happy is great and the service is fantastic! We have had the same server for about 7 months now and she is so sweet! So, if you want great service ask to be sat in Luptia's section! Great job Los Cucos!

Everything was very bland, and my dish that the waitress confirmed had no meat in it, was FULL of giant chunks of pork. Ate around the pork, but the rest tasted gross anyway. Apparently the kids meal was good - but it was chicken fingers, lol. Would not go back; worst Mexican food I've ever had.

N4wId1lJy5YgLZ8s5oG8dg.text: Las Vegas needed a Tex Mex place. Being from Houston we couldn't believe that there wasn't a single True Tex mex in the entire city and have looked for 12 years. Los Cucos is from Houston (I believe as they are all over town).  FINALLY I can get a real fajita in LV.  In Houston I would rate Los Cucos as a slightly above average Tex Mex but I am so happy to have it in LV and being it is the only one here I give it 5 stars!  THe service is excellent and the restaurant is exceptionally clean (it is brand new). They have a Sunday brunch that is pretty good. I love their chips and green salsa and the Fajitas are amazing. Don't go here looking for northern Mexican style food (Michoacan ) like u get everywhere else in town- THIS IS TRUE TEX MEX

cfBE_YU5C7YJckX1KJfVIw.text: Wife and I went here on an early Friday evening to take advantage of their happy hour. We both each had a margarita at half price and I will say the margarita was pretty good, not the greatest but very good. The food was excellent! I had the fajitas a la poblana and it was amazing. Incredible flavor, and the steak was awesome. It was cool to have some authentic mariachi music by their live band but it was pretty loud so it was hard to talk to people at the table. The service was excellent everyone checks up on you including the manager multiple times. My only complaint was when we got change for a bill that we paid for with cash, the server only gave me change to either give him a $2 tip or a $20 for a $50 bill. I don't mind giving 20 or even 25% tip but when you're trying to force me to give you a 40% tip, that doesn't fly too well with me. Lucky for him we were in a good mood so I got change from the bar to give him a good tip but do not try and force me to tip you nearly half the price of my bill unless you want me to only give you the $2 change that I had left. Other than that it would be a 5 star review.

jPSoWI9fVRBWNM4BBdSvcw.text: This was my first visit to this restaurant and my husband's second time. The hostess greeted us with a big simile and seated us at the patio, which is enclosed so it made it even better since it was a bit chilly outside. The restaurant had a clean and rustic Mexican theme decor and Obeisance to it. The waitress Adriana and Maria where both very sweet and additive to our table. The manager came over and introduced him self and asked if everything was good, of course it was and invited us to their grand opening on Friday Jan 6, 2017. I had the fish  tacos,it was absolutely delicious, with fresh Hand made tortillas and tomatillos cream sauce, and grill fish. It also came with fresh bean stew and white rice with some carrots and green onions in it. My husband had the rib eye steak dinner he really enjoyed his dish. Cooked perfect. The staff was all friendly and kind. Our water and soft drinks never went empty, top notch service.

FmxiSJOUfDpqU1A-yFSAGQ.text: I'm very impressed with Los Cucos Mexican restaurant. Me and my family are big foodies and love trying new places here in Vegas. I couldn't help but to leave a awesome review on this place. Jesus the manager welcomed us in, and sat us as we were the first ones to arrive. The drinks he made us at the bar, wow  the best Michelada I've had here in Vegas. My girlfriend ordered a spicy Bloody Mary, and she was amazed on how well it came out. Being impressed by the quality drinks we have been served, it gets better the food we ordered. Words can't even explain the thought process, that was put into the food dishes we were served. The quality of food just amazing. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for quality food and great drinks. I am in the service industry myself, and I always say quality doesn't have a price tag. So if you're looking for a great experience, then this is the place you wanna be. After we paid our bill, Jesus checked on us as we were checking out. He then had mention, they were having a Sunday brunch that started at 9:30am. He invited us back to join them. We definitely will take them up on that invite and make sure to bring our family and friends back with us. Thanks for your awesome service Jesus and staff. Everyone was awesome  -Bill

6U2cd460UzjeRfX1unLJ6Q.text: My Yelp app said this place received  3.5 stars, so I was curious...    How it ever received 3.5 stars is beyond me...  This was my first time there and I will NEVER go back.  They were not horribly busy, so I went in and sat at the bar.  The bartender greeted me quickly and asked if id like a drink and a menu..  I ordered a drink, she brought it, then I ordered something off the lunch menu.  They brought the usual chips and salsa.  Warm Salsa????  I thought it was strange to have the salsa be warm, but I tried it anyway...it was somewhat tasteless, so I switched to the next dip.. this was better than the first but still lacked something.  I was only 5 chips in and scooped what looked like a hair out of the 2nd dip...  I looked around to see if the bartender would look at it but she completely disappeared. I told myself I could be wrong... I wanted to believe I was wrong...  My first mistake was not leaving right then and there.. After 20 minutes the bartender reappeared with my food.  She warned me the plate was hot, but what she should have said was the plate is hot but the food is NOT..  I ordered the lunch taco plate..  The menu read 1 flour tortilla taco, served with pico, etc..  a bowl of tortilla soup, rice & beans. (the beans had cheese on them in the picture)..  I tried to eat the soup, but quickly discovered I had to use my knife to cut the completely oversized, undone vegetables in the bowl. After 3 bites I gave up and slid that aside.  I moved on to the beans, which was cold, tasted sour and had no cheese on them it all. I slid that aside as well...At this point I'm famished, so instead of leaving, I proceeded to try the taco.. . I realized there was no pico or cheese on the little side plate they brought.  I ended up with lettuce and 2 slices of avocado. I look up to find again the bartender/waitress disappeared. I can't even ask for any.. I opened the tortilla to discover dried up steak...  That was it... I pushed that aside and waited for the bartender to get back...  so she comes back and ask if I needed anything else.. I looked down at the plate, then back up to her and said "just a check"   She looked at my plate turned around and proceeded to bring me the check and asked if I wanted a box..  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?  In what world would someone not ask if there was a problem with the food, especially if you seen your customer barely touched the food.  That was my breaking point... I asked for the manager and low and behold he finally appears 10 minutes later...  I communicated what I experienced, explained the food was inedible, told him I was going to pay the check, leave and never return.  He half acted like he was concerned, offered to get the check only once, then proceeded to clear my plate and walked away.. He should have  insisted and tore the check up....  WOW..... the restaurant industry is so competitive, especially here. even more so with the ability to post.  The owner would be saving himself a lot of bad reviews if he took action right away.... If I owned that place, the cook, waitress and manager would be gone today.....     I've had better service and food from Del Taco.... UGH!!!

n6daCLlF8tBDCSgWBf9Tug.text: I ordered through Grubhub so I cannot say if that's the reason for my experience but I don't think so. I placed my order at 7:02 and my delivery window was 7:35-7:45. After hitting submit the delivery time changed to 8:11-8:22 which admittedly could have been because I was ordering for a family of 6. I watched my order the whole time and the delivery driver was on point, once the order said the food was ready for pickup the driver was there and headed to my house so I can only assume the reason for my experience was the restaurant.  I ordered 3 chicken taco meals and the chicken was in huge chunks, not what I was expecting. The taco "shells" were hardly shells when delivered and were so soggy  nothing would even stay in them to take a bite. My kids had to just toss the shells and eat the chunks of chicken by themselves.  We ordered 2 super burrito meals and they were just ok, nothing to write home about. I was pleasantly surprised they gave you bags of chips, salsa and guacamole with every meal but the chips were overcooked and not very good anyways. Overall for the $93 it cost to feed my family we will not be ordering from here again.

6amPu0O7DsYT6AagvU5sYg.text: The food is great, but the only reason I can' give them 5 stars is they always seem to forget something in my order. The last two to go orders i've done theyv'e missed the mark. They forgot the queso dip a week ago, and tonight they forgot the tortilla soup, and I didn't notice till I got home...

j_n-oD9tWTSFzP3vBIjDsw.text: Just had the beef fajita chimichanga, and my wife had the stuffed avocado. Both were excellent. Our server, Lupita, was very attentive and did an excellent job. All in all a satisfying and delicious lunch. We'll definitely be back!

-mG2wqeU8tyqw1tMT7f1WA.text: Their chips and salsa are freakin bomb !! I've been here more than a few times since they've opened and my husband and I love it.

N1KJxV_B4QSAuBlsg3cHtA.text: Love this place so much! Food is bomb and customer service is the best in Vegas. The chips and salsa were warm and delicious. We tried the fajita nachos and fried avocado... it was amazing!! Also got the sangria swirl which was super tasty. Cannot wait to come back and try more menu items.

obZlrHT0H6f859f2qt7uEQ.text: BEST service in Las Vegas.  Right away beautiful Marissa welcomed us with a huge smile.  Next within seconds Kenneth our bus boy was proving us with chips, salsa and guacamole dip.  Then our amazing waiter Denis arrived...welcomed us and took our drink orders.  The staffs timing and warmth was absolutely perfect.  Everyone there seemed genuinely concerned about making sure our experience was the absolute best.    The margarita (mango raspberry) was super delicious....and huge.    They are willing to make you anything you request even if it's not on the menu.  They truly care about making their quests happy.   We ordered the chicken and beef fajitas...came out sizzling hot and tasty. The tortillas appeared to be homemade.  Loved all the cilantro in the pico...yum.   We will be back.   Extra big thank you to Marissa and Denis!!  You two made our visit extraordinary!!

hh5USBQ5AeT5BhjDDlshcQ.text: What a bomb little Mexican place this is the atmosphere was great. The service was great. We didn't have food we mainly came for drinks and i had about half of the cocktail list and wow! Really good cocktails they all had great Mexican flavors great tequila too and makes it look so fun to drink. Can't wait to come back to try the food.

PDPAlq0b-CtnDPMYdyfMLA.text: Food was really good. Service was a little slow. Waited around 20 min for food but it was good

DIpUdhN2W_HnkWkBj6dpqA.text: I come here every week! The food is great and the drinks. Food quality is superb, homemade tortillas are always the best. I highly recommend the fajitas as well and flan for dessert.

PqyexsvU7f5wrkWIdM9g9g.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! Los Cucos opened recently opened and the entire family enjoys going for brunch, lunch and dinner! Their menu has an usually wide variety on food selection, price is good and customer service is truly a step above the norm.   The restaurant has three sections all with very unique feels...outdoor that is glassed in, low ceiling quaint  section and lastly a large high ceiling well lit  area with a bar. Entire restaurant is kid friendly.  They even hold the door when you enter and leave!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quick lunch with the family! Love how the girls dress in theme :)

iQ9XxRSM2L84w74Ky-Fl9g.text: The drinks were great! But the food fell short of expectations. My family and I decided to eat here due to reviews and a 4 star rating. Unfortunately the food was not the greatest. 30% of food ordered was good but consistency was not there. We were stoked to have handmade tortillas until most of them were still slightly raw.  Tacos had too much fat, if you like that then great. But not our cup of tea. Flan tasted more like cheesecake. Only thing that made our visit great was the fact that a lady who seemed to be the owner walked to all tables and wanted to hear customers feedback. She asked we told,  and she said usually because people want their food right away. We gave her our constructive feedback and said we would rather wait 5 more minutes to have better consistency and not something that seemed made in a rush without care.  She was so appreciative, thanked us and seemed to take it well.  Things we actually liked:  The red enchilada had great flavor though. The salsa for the chips were great, especially the avocado cream dip.

5SUTKtXFXR2VpUcvE4aF6w.text: Came to Los Cucos to try this new place and really liked it. The grand opening is this Friday and they will have live mariachi.  The food was really good, loved the handmade tortillas, they were really good. The house salsas are good but I needed an extra kick so they have habanero salsa upon request. I tried the lunch special and was stuffed. I will definitely comeback.

TaqpnXYBor7uAOIJZnkCzQ.text: Just left this place. Very disappointed after reading the 5 star reviews. I was really expecting this to be an unforgettable experience. For anyone looking for a genuine Mexican meal this is not the place to come. To tell you that they don't even offer aguas frescas. We waited 30 minutes for our appetizer to come and 50 minutes for our food!! There was a fan right above our table set on high speed. We asked our waitress if they can turn it down because it was blowing so hard even the signs on the tables were moving.  She said she had to ask the manager and it took them and hour to turn off the fan. The manager was  waking around making sure customers were happy with their service, but didn't even stop by our table to make sure we were. The food was bland. Not very tasty. Overall I will not be recommending this place and definitely not coming back.

JwZKCctzLpHGiWKzfsyqDA.text: Excellent food , the service is so great , i recommend this restaurant if u are into mexican food ,eloisa is a great waitress , karla and the manager where super cool , ill definitely come back here with my family.

9MqeFXsUuFX305W8jNYR1Q.text: Love this restaurant. The fajitas are so good. The onions are caramelized and so delicious. Had a great mango cocktail too. Denis is our server and he did a fabulous job taking care of us. Had a great time!!! The patio design really brings the outdoor indoor too. Awesome place!!!

GRJkFi6Pz25ufODr--U-Fw.text: Heard great things about this place. However, never even got the chance because no one was at the host desk to greet us. Stood their 8 minutes while waiters passed by with no acknowledgement. So we left and will probably never come back. Where was the host or manager??

45VPo-ujwWuS6TRvlfPAXg.text: Delicious food as always.   Ever since we tried their food it's unstoppable not to come back. Jesus the manager was really nice and very attentive.  All crews are really nice.  I can't say anything bad.  100% recommend this place.

QzEBH3gccfQT2XlBYH_I-g.text: Highly recommend.  Seated immediately and brought salsa and chips.  The salsa was warm and just right.  I ordered the ceviche as my dinner and wasn't disappointed.  The server said the one I chose was spicy and it was exactly as promised.  Highly recommend.  Two thumbs up from this family.

PPrrKfQw-vQRc8135qwc8g.text: Chimichunga was not crispy.just was not that excited about the flavor of my food or salsa.prices are to high for what you get.chicken stuffed jalapenos were so small for an entree.looked like a kid meal.they do have good margaritas on a good note.beans were not tasty and no cheese on top.thats the best part.

zz4b2qVrNa7r9Kl2ylnaRQ.text: I stopped here for lunch one day while I was in the area as I used to go here with my family in Texas and I love how I can eat Mexican food without feeling so guilty and greasy. Los Cucos is so fresh, and some of the best chicken fajitas I have ever had! Service was good...I LOVE their warm red salsa and the green salsa. So delicious. The chicken fajitas are amazing and fresh. It's more like fresh tex-mex style cuisine, not really like California hearty Mexican food. I live in Henderson, but I definitely will be back when I am in the area!

YnE9jAioExs_hG49XnzliQ.text: SUNDAY BRUUUUUNCH! YAAASSSSSS! Wow, there was so much good food to choose from on Sunday for brunch and it was only $18/19 for buffet! Good food, a ton of selection, and everyone was very attentive. You could tell they really cared. I hope this place stays and keeps its quality and prices. At least for Sunday brunch! I haven't ordered off their menu yet.

6nFrq_7vsXVneuvWBB5fjA.text: OMG!! Real Mexican food!!If you've killed your taste buds with all of the fast food kind you're probably going to put on your gripe hat here with all kinds of complaints. Here's how I see it... AMAZING!! authentic to region superbly prepared quality food knowledgeable/fun wait staff bright clean understated atmosphere a bar that can keep you happy with your selection-- very happy prices are fair especially for what you get management who cares a family business making it and expanding In short - - My drink brought many smiles to my face. The chips were free and the salsas were addicting. The shrimp were huge and tasted like they had just been pulled out of the Gulf of Mexico. I even loved the rice and I usually never touch it cuz to me it's wasted calories. And, we could have afforded ice cream on the way home but we were too full!! gECdAAHqDBSyZ4ABB2aToA.text: First of all, I was very skeptical of another bland Mexican restaurant. Being Mexican I have high expectations of the food.  When we arrived we were greeted by traditional dressed lady who escorted us to our table. There is Selena Music playing the entire time! Omg, Selena is big and I'm very impressed how this restaurant embraces Selena music. Anyways, the food was amazing! You have to try the queso fundido, it's to die for, im coming back just for this. I ordered the healthy bowl and it was absolutely amazing and healthy. My sister ordered the fajitas style platter and it was tender meat with so many flavors. Try this place, it's a must and the first one in Las Vegas!

bdcRmcNvOdUzeLVK5T9viA.text: Absolutely love this place. The food is amazing the service is amazing and the place is gorgeous inside. They give really nice portions even when you order from the lunch specials. Definitely worth every prenny and I will be going back.

1k_enmoFIgjVc0J-MRZnjQ.text: Finally tried this place after waiting way too long. Living in the Southwest we have a few favorite Mexican eateries that we frequent: Juan's Flaming Fajitas, Pinches Tacos, Chile Verde and Frijoles & Frescas. But it was time to try a new place and I'm so glad I insisted we did! My husband is always hesitant to try a new place...we value consistency and those restaurants I listed always provide us with an excellent meal and excellent service. So it's hard to breakaway and try something new. I literally can not wait to go back Los Cucos!  Right off the bat I knew it was going to be good because the salsas they brought with the chips were delicious! And my margarita was perfect! My husband ordered a  combination plate, a three cheese enchilada, a chicken enchilada and 2 chicken taquitos. He loved his meal, would have preferred the chicken been shredded or pulled rather than in chunks but still thought it was excellent. I ordered a mixed plate called el sabroso with a beef taco al carbon...the most tender and melt in your mouth beef I've ever had! It also came with a three cheese enchilada and the most delicious carnitas that fell apart with the slightest touch of a fork served with tortillas and the most incredible tomatillo sauce that I added to everything on my plate because it was just that good. I loved it all!  And even though I want to try other items on the menu, I can't imagine not ordering this again!  Since this was our first time here, all I can hope for is consistency. I'd be so disappointed if our next visit was less than amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El Sabroso Mixed Plate Dinner. So delicious!

RYhUzYTYP2shJSMsd_Np-w.text: I've only done the Sunday brunch so I haven't done their normal dinner or lunch. It is PHENOMENAL!  First, the employees running the food are dressed in traditional Mexican clothing. The girls wearing the big colorful skirts. So beautiful. The brunch is buffet style which at first made me kinda ehh as buffets tend to suck unless they're the top ones on the strip. I was entirely wrong.   The options are PLENTY but also not overwhelming. It feels like they would rather offer a decent choice of options and serve them up with quality and care instead of dumping 100 half asses options for the sake of saying they have 100 options.   You can find surprisingly fresh ceviches and aguachiles, I believe posole, a made to order taco stand, tamales, made to order chilaquiles (which is amazing as chilaquiles tend to get soggy so making them made to order is genius). Even for vegetarians this place is great and you'll find potato taquitos, cheese filled chile rellenos, nopales and other vegetarian options if that's what you seek.  They also offer regular soft drinks through the server or you can head over to the aguas naturales station. They had like 3 or 4 options when I went: watermelon, melon, and I forgot what else.   The dessert table is about equal Mexican desserts and regular American desserts. Conchas, pan dulce, Gansitos, then stuff like donuts, chocolate cakes, and a fondue station.   Service is amazing. Cleanliness is amazing. Food is amazing. I don't get how I hadn't heard of this place before. 5 stars well deserved!

WN17-DEj6XNVbGib31zYuQ.text: Wow ! I order some food via DoorDash and My goodness I drive a lot around this restaurant and never stopped ! The food was amazing, great flavors taste very fresh and the portions are huge ! Love the Salsas so much ! We definitely will stop soon to try it in the Restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Cucos Mexican Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j_oUNrAv-p8eZduyARJAcg.text: 4.5 stars, indeed!  It takes me a lot to admit things like this, but DIZZAMM! This place was off the HOOK; slamming, crackin', just the right type of food I needed--whatever you want to call it, it was GUD'! One of the many Mexican restaurants that I have eaten at and can say I honestly enjoyed my meal!  Be advised that the menu is extremely daunting, it would be a great idea to already have an idea of what you want beforehand.  Goodness, gracious!  During my recent trip to Vegas, my friends and I decided to go for Mexican food off the strip for dinner and I am SO excited we did. Los Cucos is known for their SEXY drinks, I mean, if I didn't know any better, I would have walked out of their a certified drunk!  Moving on, shall we...  Upon walking in, we were seated rather quickly. We were given menus and asked if we wanted to start with any drinks. I opted to order the sexy margarita as my friends ordered the sexy drinks that looked dangerous! :: Emoji Heart Eyes::  As I received my drink, our table also received complimentary chips and salsa which were delicious and tasty for a snack. If you get the salsa, make sure to order the green salsa as it was a nice compliment to the chips and was the BEST I've ever tasted in my 28 years of living; GOODNESS! With two young children and 3 adults, I must admit that our server did a wonderful job making sure we were well taken care of. Our table ordered a little bit of everything, I went for the Crab enchiladas with double rice. My food was everything I asked for and MORE; very flavorful and left me satisfied, indeed. Admittedly, the portions are very huge, enough for me to food to go for the next day. The waitstaff was very attentive and was readily available every time our water glasses got low.  They have a wonderful happy hour that is only eligible if you are sitting at the bar. Alas, we were not able to receive the happy hour as we had two young kids with us. I would have loved to see Happy Hour be available inside the whole restaurant no matter where you sit.  It would be truly a five-star restaurant if there was some music while we ate and have several drinks--just sayin'!  I love a server that uses the phrase, "Is everything okay" continuously when checking in. It shows that they care and want to make sure you have a good visit, and that's exactly what we did!  There is no doubt that I'll be back!

The food is good , the service is good and the place can always accommodate our big groups last minute . My favorite things are the shrimp stuffed jalapenos and the smothered burrito . Those are the best things I've ordered here . The prices are very reasonable for he portion size . We always have left overs . ZO5gLLMmoDRCa2ILLv8rhw.text: I came here for their buffet which is only available on Sunday during a certain time (I think it's 10-2 but I could be wrong). I had high expectations for this place because my friends had hyped it up for me. Also there's a lack of good authentic Mexican food in the southwest Vegas area. So, I was excited and ready to try this spread of food.  The buffet met allll my expectations. They had freshly made carnitas, al pastor, and chicken tacos. I was told their barbacoa was the best but they didn't have it on the day. This only means that another trip here is in order. I am not mad bout that. They had all the basics of what you would expect at a Mexican buffet like enchiladas, sopes, menudo, chorizo & eggs, random meats etc. The ceviche was unexpected and for a buffet amazingly delicious! They had 3 different kinds -- shrimp, crab, and some sort of fish. I didn't expect it to be fresh but it sure was.  I really loved the champurrado, the Mexican coffee, and the strawberry milk. Such a good cap to my already delicious meal!!!   The whole meal with tax and tips were about $25. Good value, good quality food, good location. I will be back soon :)

BSpVmQqQ92FFwoZRwsLuTA.text: The food was absolutely phenomenal! Good portion sizes and really delicious flavor combinations. Not to be missed if you are downtown and looking for a delicious brunch spot. highly recommend this place

xA7bSxhFFzYMV3NUNNwxkw.text: When you first walk in to this restaurant, you automatically get that "traditional" Mexican vibe.  It's decorated so vibrantly and I love the bright lighting!  They are definitely more on the pricey side, with entrees all $12+.  We ordered a combo plate with taquitos and enchiladas, and also healthy chicken and veggies quesadilla made on wheat tortillas.  The food was amazing! Everything, including the salsas for the complimentary chips, had such great flavors!  My only issue was that on my "healthy" quesadilla, the menu indicated it was all vegetables and chicken with "light cheese."  However, it came out with copious amounts of cheese. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE cheese, and it was delicious! But I was trying to get a healthier option on this occasion, and it didn't quite hit the mark on that. Service was good, and the place was very clean!  Great place!

07SjQZ23HE-t9S3HP8lVPw.text: Passing thru town, stopped in for a quick bite. the food was good, the service was friendly and the restaurant was very clean.  Loved the decor :)

QP5HuGAWuD3H_SnZ1vAoyw.text: This restaurant is hidden in the back where Chile's is. Random, but does not go unnoticed!   Ive had this as take out for work and also sat and dined in. Everyone was so helpful and the service was top notch. You can tell they care for their guests.   I've had tacos here once before and I was in love. Delicious! The meats were so flavorful! This last visit, we went and grabbed a grill special. We ordered the Parrilla San Luis for two people. That was about $48. A lot of food! Came with shrimp, carnitas, chicken, chicken quesadilla, and jalapeno sausage. Came in sizzling!  All meats were tender and flavorful. Cooked to perfection. The sausage was def a but spicy but nothing I couldnt handle. We also got a plate each with rice, beans, greens, a bit of guacamole, pico de gallo and some tortillas. It was a great amount of food that we could not finish! No room for dessert.   We admit, we werent fans of the salsa. Seemed watered down and we had to ask for hotter salsa. Our waitress did not disappoint and came through with something hotter. So, we were really happy with that!   The restaurant was bright in color but still comfortable. Waitresses were all dressed up all gorgeous. There was a birthday going on in the other room and the staff went over and sang their hearts out. It was cute. lol.   Would definitely come back here for sure. Try something else next time. :D

9z6ASxU-pfUq89CAq99-kg.text: I am giving this two stars because I would never want to come back and try food here again. It's not even OK if that is the case. Compared to other Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas, this is one of the worst that I have been to. The service was actually OK. We had no issues with that. The menu is chock-full of chicken. If you are a vegetarian, this is not a restaurant for you. There was only one clear vegetarian meal which was the spinach enchiladas in the whole wheat tortilla wraps with cheese. I ordered their ceviche and it is one of the worst I've ever had. What was really strange is that they had actual ceviche and then they had boiled shrimp next to it. It was very odd and the taste was just OK. Their refried beans tasted like it had a lot of cumin spice in it so it wasn't very good. The Margarita was OK but I've had way better. The prices are reasonable but the food is just mediocre at best. I would not come back here again. Total disappointment.

LP4hR66miXztmdxfipzbNA.text: We were in town visiting my sister and she recommended Los Cucos for brunch on Sunday. I wasn't too excited as most Mexican buffets are not really that good.  HOWEVER Los Cucos surpassed my expectations! Coming from Los Angeles my first though driving to the restaurant was the longgggg wait we would encounter as ALL restaurants in LA you have a minimum of an hour wait on Sundays. This was not the case here; we arrived and got seated that same moment.  Food selection for the brunch was small but you had your variety. There is an egg and omelet station to the left of the food area for the brunch. Down the middle you have your Sea food, Fruit and Mexican dishes selection. And to the far end you have your taco station. They also have an Aguas Frescas station (natural fruit juice) they have a coffee station that includes champurrado (corn dough chocolate Mexican atole) and hot chocolate. You also have your dessert table with a variety of Mexican sweet bread and cakes. There is cereal and milk also included in the dessert table.  Food selection was great! There was Chiles Rellenos, Carne en su Jugo, Shrimp in pasta, Rice, Beans, enchiladas, sopes, quesadillas, menudo and so much more.   Food is good, service is good.  I would say definitely a place to try. I'm looking forward to visit my sisters again to have brunch here.

cWP8K98dNxvFcaO8aixbrA.text: Went there for the first time Friday night , service was amazing and the food was outstanding, and the margaritas, one of those babies will put you on your butt!
